activities.subject: RESPONSE: "Understanding the <NRP> Experience" eLearning/ML
activities.body:
Hi, y’all.

Please see thread below

Summary: Our prospect <PERSON> has expressed interest in an “Understanding the Muslim Experience in America” digital asset – either eLearning or microlearning. He said that he’s drawn to the eLearning but is “wondering if given the timeline to develop, I opted for [microlearning] to get something out to our team members.”

This is something I conferred with <PERSON> about, when <PERSON> asked for pricing, then provided the 3 options below. He’s referring to options 1 and 2, which I’ve highlighted in blue for you.

Let’s meet either tomorrow morning, if you can? Or right after Thanksgiving.  It will be either a $90k or $60k deal.

Thoughts?

Thank you, RP

<PERSON>
(she/her)
Head of Client Solutions
XYZ

activities.subject: RE: "Understanding the <NRP> Experience" + Spotlights
activities.body:
Good Morning <PERSON>,

What timeframe are you looking for? Let us connect internally to move around some projects and accommodate it. We are looking forward to working with you and your team at BakerTilly. It may be best to schedule a call to confirm logistics? What does your week permit. I am really happy to hear you are feeling better, I hope you have the opportunity to get some much-needed rest at the end of this week.

Separately, <PERSON>, I would like to connect to discuss your findings around linking revenue, retention, and what other metrics you were able to uncover with your analysts that tie engagement of your executives in DEIB work and their results.

Happy Tuesday 😊

<PERSON>

<PERSON> (She/Her)
Co-CEO and Managing Partner
XYZ

Please pardon the delay. Between work-related travel and being out sick, I’ve fallen behind. I’m most drawn to option #1 but I’m wondering if given the timeline to develop, I opted for option #2 to get something out to our team members.

The ADL has an eLearning on antisemitism that I think would be easy to add to our internal Udemy series. But I’d also like for there to be an <NRP> learning in parallel or at least  fast follow.

Welcome the thoughts of the group.

activities.subject: Digital options for "Understanding the Muslim Experience"
activities.body:
CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

Hi <PERSON>, I got your OOO that you were sick, we hope you’re feeling better.

We wanted to follow up on your question about digital options for “Understanding the Muslim Experience,” the Cultural Immersion workshop that we shared last week.

I spoke with our team and here are cost and turnaround estimates for a couple of options:


  1.  “Understanding the Muslim Experience” eLearning (approx. 40 min duration)

     *   Built on robust eLearning platform (Articulate Storyline, allows for voiceover and numerous interactivity choices)
     *   Turnaround time: Minimum 12 weeks
     *   Cost: $90k


  1.  “Understanding the Muslim Experience” 2-microlesson version (approx. 2 sections per microlesson):

     *   Built on robust eLearning platform (Articulate Storyline)
     *   Each section includes the following components: reading (intro), recorded facilitation (pre-recorded video, including one <NRP> cultural insider and one ally non-cultural insider), an interactive activity, and a self-reflection.
     *   Turnaround time: 10-12 weeks
     *   Cost: $60k


  1.  “Spotlight on the Muslim Community” microlearning (condensed content)

     *   Built on less robust microlearning platform (Articulate Rise)
     *   Turnaround time: 4-6 weeks
     *   Cost: $30k

Copying my colleague <PERSON>, in case I got anything wrong in the above.

<PERSON>, look forward to hearing from you when you’re feeling better!

Best, <PERSON>

<PERSON>
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
XYZ

activities.subject: Following up from Friday - boosting cultural literacy @ <PERSON>
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON> – so nice to meet you last Friday.

In addition to what <PERSON> sent below, I wanted to send you the info on the identity-specific Spotlights sessions that I mentioned on Friday – in case you’re thinking about 2024 programming right now. These Spotlights represent an opportunity to engage in authentic, yearlong cultural literacy upskilling around the cultures that <PERSON> consultants and staff belong to and are influenced and inspired by.

Our culture-specific Spotlights are not superficial – they’re one-hour, interactive, deep-dive sessions that are focused on the experience of being a member of these communities. They align with your overall DEI strategy and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills, and a culture of belonging.

Here’s an example of how they can be rolled out in 2024:


Spotlight on…
Suggested Delivery Month in 2024
1
Black/African American Community
February (Black History Month)
2
Women in Leadership
March (Women’s History Month)

3
Being an Ally for the Asian American Community
May (AAPI Heritage Month)
4
The LGBTQ+ Community
June (LGBTQ+ Pride Month)
5
Persons with Disabilities
July (Disability Pride Month)
6
The <NRP>/Latinx/e Community
September (Hispanic Heritage Month)
7
Indigenous People in <LOCATION>
October (Indigenous Peoples’ Day) or November (Native American Heritage Month)
8
U.S. Veterans Community
November (Veterans’ Day)
9
U.S. Generations
December (Or April or August)

Spotlights contain topics like:

  *   Relevant statistics and data that communicate this community’s makeup, impact, and experiences
  *   The community’s values, priorities, strengths
  *   Dispelling any myths or stereotypes about the community
  *   Challenges or barriers members of this group tend to face in the workplace, and
  *   Strategies & tips for what participants can do to broaden inclusion and belonging for members of this community.

Both people managers and individual contributors consistently find these sessions relevant and applicable for their workplace goals and relationships.

If you purchase all of the above workshops, we’re prepared to give you a 20% discount when you pay up front.

(You may substitute one or more of the above with non-identity-centered 1-hr workshops if you wish – such as “How Culture Influences Communication Style”, “Building Executive Presence Among a Diverse Group of Leaders”, “Fostering Inclusive Leadership”, “Intro to Navigating Global Cultures” or “Building Stronger Virtual Relationships”. ).

Let us know what you think!

Best, <PERSON> and the XYZ Team


<PERSON>
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
XYZ

activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

I wanted to follow up on my email from last week. I am looking to schedule a brief 20-30 minute call to discuss the current challenges to inclusive leadership and management programs and how our other clients are working to ensure an inclusive workplace that maintains their company's values.

I'd love to hear what you folks are thinking about and what you're planning/doing. I can share what trends I am hearing from other clients and how XYZ can help your organization succeed across differences.

Schedule time: Use this link <<URL>>

I look forward to connecting.

activities.subject: Let's catch up on DEI trends - quick call?
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

I hope this email finds you well and enjoying the new year.  I am reaching out to a few valued clients-past and present-to schedule a brief listening session about DEI at their organizations.

There is a lot of discourse about DEI right now and much of it is unhelpful to people charged with solving complex people dynamics in the workplace. I'd love to spend a few minutes chatting about what's happening in the space these days. I'm eager to hear about your employee lifecycle challenges, your insights, and share some of the trends we're seeing with our clients.

Would you be open to a brief call next week? I promise to keep it short and valuable.

Let me know if you have 15-30 minutes to spare - I'll be happy to work around your schedule. Below is my <NRP> link if you want to find the best time for you.

<URL>

Looking forward to reconnecting!

Good morning, <PERSON>,

My apologies for the delayed response. We just launched a huge initiative over the last month and my emails have taken a bit of a hit.

Thanks so much for reaching out to us to see if we might still have interest in partnering with XYZ. We think your product and services are wonderful but unfortunately due to a giant integration between two health systems, our budget didn’t allow such a partnership. We ended up working to build some internal courses to fit our needs. However, we will keep XYZ’s work and information in our files for potential future collaboration.

Again, thank you so much for the follow up and please share with <PERSON> our gratitude for all she did to explore a partnership with us.

I hope you have had a lovely holiday season and a great start to 2023!
 
I’m checking in since sending an overview of XYZ’s services and programs. Have you had a chance to take a look? If not, I’ve attached it for your convenience. We’d love to set up another meeting to hear your thoughts. I’ve included a few potential meeting times below.

activities.body:
<PERSON>,
 
It was such a pleasure to meet you this month and learn about Sunday’s Sky’s DEI initiatives from awareness days to unconscious bias training. I’ve attached our proposal which highlights an overview of our services, our training portfolio, and select facilitations we offer.
 
In addition, you mentioned an interest in learning about the backgrounds of our consultants which can be found on our Meet Our Team (<URL>) page.  As a start, we suggest you take a glance at the bios of <PERSON>, <PERSON>, and <PERSON>.
We'd love the opportunity to speak with you again and learn how we can best support your initiatives.  While we know that the holidays can be difficult for scheduling, our team can meet at your convenience.  Is there a time after January 3rd that works for you? Feel free to find a time on our <NRP> here: <URL> (<URL>)
Thank you for your time and we look forward to hearing from you soon!

activities.subject: RE: Contract for review
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,
Thanks for sending this over so quickly. I’m not seeing the 30% discount reflected on the SOW that Hannah & Melissa shared with us. Attaching the email chain for reference.

Hello <PERSON> and <PERSON>,
 
I hope you had an enjoyable long weekend!
 
I’m reaching out to check in if you had a chance to view XYZ’s three E-learnings (Embedding Inclusion, Practicing Inclusion, and Introduction to Managing Unconscious Bias) and if you’re still able to meet in early June.
 
I see that XYZ has a conflicting meeting on June 5th but I’ll move the tentative meeting to June 7th. Please let me know if that time will work for you.
 
Thank you for your time and we are here for any of your questions!

Hello <PERSON>,
 
Thank you for your clarification. I’m unsure how we’d best be able to accommodate for Cue Health. I’ll confer with <PERSON> and get back to you shortly on this as well as what we may be able to send regarding manager essentials/new manager training. We may need further clarification before sending information but I’ll be in touch.
 
In the meantime, I’ve just sent the e-learning demo links to <PERSON> and <PERSON> with you and <PERSON> cc’d for reference. Also, we should be able to move the meeting on the 12th to 2pm PST/5pm EST. I’ll make that adjustment now.
 
We’ll be in touch soon regarding signing a contract before the 30th and sending additional training!

activities.subject: Re: CUE Health + XYZ Follow-Up
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>, 
Our internal procurement process can take a bit of time - we are wondering if signing a contract before the 30th would be sufficient to receive the discount? In addition, we have the proposed courses you shared with us regarding DEIB, but as you know things have shifted greatly at Cue Health since the start of the year, and there may be additional needs for our employees and managers. Could you please send us a full cateology of manager essentials or new manager training XYZ offers? <PERSON> and I are in pacific time and our upcoming meeting at 8am on June 12th does not work great for us, could we push that meeting back to 8:30am PT or 2pm PT?Thanks,<PERSON>

Hello <PERSON>,
 
Just letting you know I heard back from <PERSON> and she confirmed that all programs you have access to (Embedding Inclusion, Practicing Inclusion, and Introduction to Managing Unconscious Bias) have been extended until May 15th.
 
Let us know if you have any follow-up questions and when would be a confirmed time to tentatively meet.

activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

activities.note_body: Email chain between <PERSON> and <PERSON>, June 2023 to Oct 6. 2023:From: <PERSON> Sent: Friday, October 6, 2023 9:10 AMTo: <URL>cDonald@<URL>Subject: FW: Limited-Time Discount on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHi Louise,I hope everything is going well with you!I wanted to reach out to see how the decision making process is going on the eLearnings. Please let me know if you have any questions.We do have an end-of-year promotion of 20% off to help our clients wrap up the year successfully. I’m happy to through how that would pricing for <URL>,<PERSON>: <PERSON> Sent: Monday, September 11, 2023 9:25 AMTo: MacDonald, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHI <PERSON>,I hope your summer has wrapped up <URL>ease let me know if you have any additional questions about moving forward with some/all of these <URL>,<PERSON> From: <PERSON> Sent: Tuesday, August 1, 2023 4:11 PMTo: MacDonald, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHi Louise,Dropping one language would reduce the price by $4,000. Please let me know if you have any <URL>anks!Dan  From: MacDonald, <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>> Sent: Tuesday, August 1, 2023 1:31 PMTo: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: Re: Limited-Time Discount on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHi DanielThanks for checking in. With holidays I’m still waiting for feedback from our head of recruitment but it is looking like we will progress with some of these courses this year and perhaps <URL>ven the audience we may not need a traditional <NRP> translated version. If this was the case, what would this do to the price?Thanks <PERSON> from <PERSON> for iOSFrom: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Sent: Tuesday, August 1, 2023 5:49:04 PMTo: MacDonald, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionDO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and are expecting the contents.Hi <PERSON>,I hope you’re doing well! I am just checking in to see your thoughts on the microlearnings. Please let me know if you have any <URL>ank you,<PERSON>: <PERSON> Sent: Tuesday, July 11, 2023 3:12 PMTo: MacDonald, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHi Louise,I hope your week is going well! I just wanted to check in to see how your review was going and to answer any questions you may <URL>anks!DanFrom: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>> Sent: Monday, June 26, 2023 12:33 PMTo: MacDonald, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: Re: Limited-Time Discount on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionYes, absolutely!Thanks!DanGet Outlook for iOSFrom: <PERSON>, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Sent: Monday, June 26, 2023 12:24:05 PMTo: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHi DanQuick question if I forward these onto my head of talent and HRD will they be able to access?Thanks LouiseFrom: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>> Sent: Friday, June 23, 2023 5:49 PMTo: MacDonald, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionDO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and are expecting the contents.Hi <PERSON>,Please see below. Let me know if you have any <URL>naging <PERSON> in Performance Reviews <URL> In this short (10-15 minute) course, you’ll learn how to become more aware of personal biases so that we can attend to them and interrupt them while evaluating our team members’ performance and conducting performance reviews.  Managing Bias in Talent Reviews <URL> In this short (10-15 minute) course, you’ll learn ways to reduce your bias in the talent review process so that you can promote diversity, inclusion, and objectivity, and mitigate unconscious bias that may be hampering your best intentions when it comes to reviewing talent.  Managing <PERSON> in Hiring <URL> This short (10-15 minute) course allows us to become aware of our biases so that we can attend to them and interrupt them while evaluating and selecting diverse top talent. Managing <PERSON> in Interviewing <URL> In this short (10-15 minute) course, you’ll learn ways to mitigate unconscious biases during job interviews, so that you can promote diversity, inclusion, and objectivity and mitigate biases that may be undermining your best intentions when it comes to interviewing job candidates.  Managing <PERSON> in Recruiting <URL> In this short (10-15 minute) course, you’ll learn ways to mitigate unconscious biases during the talent sourcing and recruitment process, so that you can find and recognize diverse top talent more effectively.  Thank you,<PERSON>: MacDonald, <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>> Sent: Friday, June 23, 2023 3:18 AMTo: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHi Dan – could you give me access to the demos please?Thanks LouiseFrom: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>> Sent: Thursday, June 22, 2023 10:15 PMTo: MacDonald, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionDO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and are expecting the contents.Hi <PERSON>,<PERSON> to hear from you!Perpetual site licenses on these courses, in all 4 languages (English, <NRP>, Traditional <NRP>, and Simplified <NRP>) would be $28,500/course. If you purchase 3 or more courses at once, the fee drops to $24,500 per <URL>ease let me know if you have any questions or if you would like access to <URL>ank <PERSON>: MacDonald, <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>> Sent: Thursday, June 22, 2023 9:06 AMTo: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: RE: <PERSON> on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHi DanielThank you for reaching out. We have had further internal discussions on what we want to achieve with our e-learning offering and are looking to change tact a little. Rather than provide another e-learning module and roll out as required training alongside the Introduction to Unconcious Bias Training we want to now explore supplementing Introduction to Unconcious Bias Training with microlearning at key points where bias may be more <URL>om previous literature we have had from LWC these are the courses I am considering:  Could you advise current pricing for perpetual unlimited enterprise site license hosted on client’s internal LMS system and translation into Latin Spanish, Traditional <NRP> and Simplified <NRP> for one or multiple courses and coBest wishes, LouiseFrom: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>> Sent: Wednesday, June 7, 2023 8:51 PMTo: MacDonald, <PERSON><EMAIL_ADDRESS>>Subject: Limited-Time Discount on New Work & Upcoming Preview SessionHi Louise,I hope you’re having a great week!I’m reaching out to you to let you know about a new campaign offering being introduced from now until June 30th!As we look to the second half of the year, we’d like to help you make the most of your budget and strategize on how to reach your organization’s goals. To help you make quick and sustainable progress at <LOCATION>, XYZ is offering a limited-time 30% discount on any new statement of work signed by 30 June 2023. This includes eLearning subscriptions and/or licenses that we have previously discussed. To allow your team to experience XYZ content in action, I’d like to invite you and three of your colleagues to an invite-only full preview session of our “Spotlight on the LGBTQ+ Community,” <URL>in us on Thursday, 15 June at 10am CT-US as we explore gender expansive identities, inclusive language practices, and how to best support colleagues in the LGBTQ+ community. To reserve your seat, use your last name as the registration code for yourself and up to three of your colleagues!I look forward to hearing from <NRP>,<PERSON>

We're looking forward to hearing from you soon.

activities.subject: Autodesk Talent Review BI RFP: Finalist Selection - XYZ
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

I hope you are having a great week!

Thank you for your patience while we completed evaluations internally!

I’m excited and happy to share that XYZ has been selected as an RFP finalist. Concerning next steps, we are conducting a final round of calls to discuss your offering and pricing specific questions live with the team. Can you please provide your availability for Monday the 15th and Tuesday the 16th? I will then work with our internal team to get a meeting scheduled and from there, we plan to make a selection as well as award the RFP business by mid to end of next week (we have a meeting scheduled with leadership Wednesday, the 17th).

Looking forward to reconnecting next week!

activities.subject: XYZ RFP Submission
activities.body:
Dear <PERSON>,

We are delighted to present XYZ’s response to Autodesk’s Selection of a Preferred Vendor for the Bias Interrupter Role Training for the Talent Review Process RFP. We are grateful you contacted our company and would be thrilled to partner with you through this initiative.

XYZ has helped global organizations craft custom solutions that advance cultural competency for over two decades. We believe sharing perspectives fosters deeper connections and enriched collaboration. By partnering with organizations of all sizes, we have dedicated our efforts to helping organizations identify and mitigate biases so that they represent the communities in which they operate.

We are grateful for this opportunity and look forward to hearing from you soon.

activities.subject: RE: Autodesk Talent Review BI RFP: Finalist Selection - XYZ
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>! This is fantastic news.  I know that <PERSON> will be following up regarding scheduling shortly, but in the meantime I wonder if you could give us an idea of how long the call might be? Should we plan for an hour?  Also, will you please let us know if you have any specific agenda or require a formal presentation?

We're delighted to have this opportunity and look forward to seeing you again soon!

activities.subject: RE: Let's catch up on DEI trends - quick call?
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

I wanted to follow up on my email from last week. I am looking to schedule a brief 20-30 minute call to discuss the current challenges to inclusive leadership and management programs and how our other clients are working to ensure an inclusive workplace that maintains their company's values.

I'd love to hear what you folks are thinking about and what you're planning/doing. I can share what trends I am hearing from other clients and how XYZ can help your organization succeed across differences.

Schedule time: Use this link <<URL>>

I look forward to connecting.

activities.subject: Let's catch up on DEI trends - quick call?
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

I hope this email finds you well and enjoying the new year.  I am reaching out to a few valued clients-past and present-to schedule a brief listening session about DEI at their organizations.

There is a lot of discourse about DEI right now and much of it is unhelpful to people charged with solving complex people dynamics in the workplace. I'd love to spend a few minutes chatting about what's happening in the space these days. I'm eager to hear about your employee lifecycle challenges, your insights, and share some of the trends we're seeing with our clients.

Would you be open to a brief call next week? I promise to keep it short and valuable.

Let me know if you have 15-30 minutes to spare - I'll be happy to work around your schedule. Below is my <NRP> link if you want to find the best time for you.

<URL>

Looking forward to reconnecting!

Hello <PERSON>,
 
I hope this email finds you well after an enjoyable or restful weekend!
 
I’m following up to see if your team has an updated decision deadline regarding the Autodesk RFP. If any additional information is needed from us, please don’t hesitate to reach out.
 
Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

We recognize the decision to create a sustainable culture of inclusion within your organization and are excited by the clear alignment. Thank you and please keep us updated, if there is anything else that you need to support our work starting together.


<PERSON>

activities.subject: RE: Contract for our Workshop
activities.body:
Thank you so much, <PERSON>. That is incredibly generous, and I appreciate it.

We have to go through the formal process of getting our budget approved by the executive committee. As soon as that goes through I’ll circle back to sign a contract and schedule the date of the training.

I appreciate your patience as I worked through the layers of approval.

activities.subject: RE: Contract for our Workshop
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

Thank you for your transparent communication with us. The proposal submitted was based off of focusing on maximizing deliverables (we discounted and comped consulting hours and multiple facilitators) vs price. It sounds like price is the issue here, so I am comfortable with us discounting this further, we are invested in this partnership.


  1.  I am happy to schedule a call to support you and our partnership with your CEO. We have found that discussing the strategic initiatives we are choosing to work on together with the C-suite, and supporting the relevant data points that will follow goes a long way. We are ecstatic for the impact we can drive together that is beyond both of our <LOCATION> based businesses.
  2.  I approve discounting this project further by another 20%. This would lower the cost to $7,200 and maintain the consulting hours (comped).


Please let me know if that will address the concerns. Happy to schedule a quick call to best understand what can support this initiative moving forward.

activities.subject: RE: Contract for our Workshop
activities.body:
Dear Emily,

Thank you very much for sharing the concerns; we completely understand and truly value your partnership. I’m looping in <PERSON> who will be reaching out to you today.  You’ll hear from her shortly.

activities.subject: RE: Contract for our Workshop
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

Thank you so much!

In going through the budget, our CEO is a bit concerned at the cost. We’re working to give XYZ a discounted membership – both <PERSON> and <PERSON> are attending upcoming programming to determine what level of membership they feel is the best fit – so I wanted to see if it would be possible to work on the amount in any way. That is a large cost in our budget in terms of other trainings and partnerships, so they wanted me to reach out to inquire.

It is definitely important to me that we do this, so I remain committed. Please let me know what makes the most sense.

activities.subject: RE: Contract for our Workshop
activities.body:
Dear Emily,

activities.subject: RE: Contract for our Workshop
activities.body:
Hello <PERSON> and <PERSON>,

I spoke with our VP of Operations and we have to get our FY24 budget approved by our executive committee before we can sign the contract.

For this reason, coupled with our CEOs vacation schedule in July and August, we’d like to schedule this for a date in September.

Since we won’t be able to sign the contract until July when the budget has been approved, please let us know if we’re able to schedule the date now, or should follow up with you in July for a new contract and date.

Sorry for the delay, but we’re still committed to moving forward.

Hi Emily! I hope you are gearing up for the weekend. As promised, here is the contract for our upcoming engagement, with the details we discussed yesterday added in. Take a look, and if everything looks good, you can sign. Do let me know if any revisions are needed.

I have not had a chance to get the project manager assigned yet, and since I’m going to be out of the office all next week, I’m copying <PERSON> on this email in case you need anything while I’m out!

Have a great weekend and week, and I look forward to speaking with you soon!

activities.call_body: We just had a situation in a <NRP> event where a person of color in the audience yelled out in support of a speaker. One of our staff members asked the person to refrain from shouting out for the remainder of the event. However, the attendee was very upset.  In turn, one of our black employees is also upset. The team has asked for cultural competence training. Can we ensure that this is discussed in the session? Perhaps not this event, but case studies or examples of instances where culture is a factor. How can we teach the staff how to create an inclusive work environment and an interact with diverse community in a cultural sensitve way.

activities.call_title: Call with Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce
activities.call_body: 2-hour all staff training and either pay for it or get $10K membership to be on board. Would like to do the training in December and is open to in person or virtual. Conference on 9/19 is on policy and then digital design is on 9/26. Quarterly meetings and Burnham dinner is coming up and is a great event coming up. Working with folks from the mayors office to support the talent pipeline.

activities.subject: Power of Allyship Proposal
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

I hope this email finds you well. I'm excited to deliver the proposal on The Power of Allyship, which we discussed during our last meeting. As we both know, allyship is crucial in creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, and I believe this proposal will be of great interest to you and your team.

The proposal includes an outline of our facilitated training session, The Power of Allyship, as well as a complimentary E-Learning opportunity that would serve as a great follow up to the session.

I am confident that this proposal will meet your expectations and provide valuable insights to your team. I'm attaching a PDF that will provide an overview of our session as well as a link for you to access the proposal:
<URL>

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns. I am happy to schedule a follow-up call to discuss the proposal further.

Thank you for considering this proposal. I look forward to hearing your thoughts!

activities.subject: You're invited to our Sustainable Culture of Inclusion Webinar!
activities.body:
Hi Anna​,

I hope you’re having a great week! I’m writing today to invite you to our upcoming webinar, “Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance.”

Join XYZ Principal Consultant <PERSON> and Associate Consultant <PERSON> on Wednesday, July 12 at 1pm CT for a closer look at how XYZ’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion Model can foster belonging in the workplace and produce equitable outcomes for employees. 

In this session, we will:
Share the genesis & structure of the SCI Model Discuss how we use the SCI model to diagnose organizations’ current state Provide two case studies that demonstrate the model’s impact 
Reserve your seat: <URL>

Hope to see you there!

activities.note_body: Waud Capital Partners Discovery Notes4/19/23Attendees: AnnaXYZ Attendees: <PERSON>·        <PERSON> has been at the company for 2 and a half years.·        <PERSON> is part of the people’s operations team.·        <PERSON> leads a women ERG for WCP.·        WCP focuses on software and tech and healthcare.·        DEI Committee used to meet monthly now turned into every other month for ERG Group.·        The Power of Allyship is what piqued her interest.·        <PERSON> spoke about how XYZ helps build systems and shape mindsets.·        Culture first approach through XYZ·        <PERSON> wants to make sure as many people as possible can see that session. (Power of Allyship)·        <PERSON> asked how long the session last? 2 hours.·        <PERSON> asked how many consultants are involved? 2.·        <PERSON> mentioned 25 to 30 being the sweet spot for this type of group session.·        <PERSON> asked about virtual or in person. Virtual makes more sense according to her budget.·        <PERSON> spoke about how WCP has created 4 pillars for their DEI.·        Internal education and awareness, recruiting, community, and portfolio. (Important for them to have diverse clients and vendors)·        <PERSON> mentions an opportunity to have general diversity training as well as leadership training for up to 6 partners. (All white men, old school thinkers)·        She has a budget of $6,000 for this ERG group and is interested in starting with the Power of Allyship.·        Towards the end of the call, we also identified WCP has a separate budget for DEI training, so more opportunity down the line.

On Tue, May 30, 2023 at 11:32 AM <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS><mailto:<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>> wrote:
Dear Carly & Angela,

I hope that this email finds you both well! I know that it is late notice, but we'd love it if you could join us at our webinar this afternoon. <PERSON> is one of the facilitators for the event titled “ Ask an Expert Anything: Responding to Resistance to DEI.” It starts in about thirty minutes and prior registration is required<<URL>> but it is not too late. You're more than welcome to invite others to the session as well.

When we last met, we talked about sharing a few questions that might help you hone in on your immediate needs for the organization. Here are a few that come to mind, and we'd love to hop on a call to discuss your responses and other questions to help you get started.

  *   What are two top priorities for HawkSEM in 2023? (Does not have to be DEI specific)
  *   What aspect of your DEI-centric work has been positively received? Why?
  *   Describe an unmet need or area of expertise that would benefit the talent recruitment and retention process.
  *   What does successful DEI strategy look like to you?
If you can't attend today, let us know. We'll be happy to send you a recording of the session.

Hi <PERSON>,
How are you today?

My name is <PERSON> and I'm a longtime I'm a longtime consultant, facilitator, and content developer at XYZ. I understand you spoke with <PERSON> and <PERSON> earlier this year about DEI/cultural intelligence learning interventions for Tarte. I also understand you sat in on one of our "Understanding the Black Experience in America" sessions when you were at L'Oreal - that's fantastic! Probably co-facilitated by <PERSON>, one of my favorite people.

I know at the time you spoke with <PERSON> and <PERSON>, you were focused on an inclusive people plan and you were doing a lot of internal listening and research. I also know you were looking at putting some structure around your recruiting and hiring process, you were prioritizing building and maintaining a psychologically safe culture and wanted to focus on retention as well, and you were also planning how to upskill managers around inclusive leadership behaviors including giving feedback inclusively.

I know <PERSON> sent you a pdf with a sampling of our solutions, but I wonder if you and I could meet to start from scratch, if you're still looking for support around DEI?

This is my bio -->

activities.subject: Minnesota Twins & XYZ Follow Up
activities.body:
Dear <PERSON>,

It was lovely to see you again and I appreciate how much you shared about your goals and needs around DEI programming. I recognize that you are in a unique organization with nuanced challenges in scaling training. Our team is adept at curating programming that meets people where they are in their understanding of DEI and also at utilizing learning modalities that make these important pieces of training accessible to all constituents.

I'm attaching an overview of our firm and some of the programs that come to mind as possible solutions. Because our eLearning is a subscription model, we can easily build out a subscription for you that includes multiple programs and distinct learning paths. I include a few samples of those for you on the attached.

Additionally, I remember you stressing a need to curate experiential learning opportunities where leaders engage and practice the act of inclusion, while also action planning. Our program, Leading with Conscious Inclusion, is designed specifically for this type of learning experience and so I've included information on that program as well. The program can be facilitated as a stand alone program; however, if the participants are new to inclusive leadership or to exploring their roles in creating a sustainable culture of inclusion, we do recommend that they begin with the Building a Culture of Inclusion program. 

To best support you, I'd love to get time on your calendar and include one of our principal consultants. By including them, we can really hone in on the best recommendations for you and you'll have the opportunity to ideate with our thought leaders. 

Do you have some time this week to connect? If so, you're welcome to schedule time on my calendar: <URL> I'm really looking forward to continuing our conversation.

activities.subject: Advancing DEI in the Workplace
activities.body:
Dear Cecilia​,

Beginning in 2020, we saw a resurgence of companies making unprecedented commitments to advancing DEI in the workplace. However, recently, we're hearing that many of these DEI initiatives are stalling. If this is happening in your workplace, I want to share a few resources with you.

On Tuesday, May 30 at 12pm: <URL> we are going to be hosting a webinar called “Ask an Expert Anything: Responding to Resistance to DEI,” facilitated by Executive Coach and Master Facilitator <PERSON>, <PERSON>, SPHR. This forum will be safe space to explore ways to overcome resistance in the workplace and will help you to identity specific language to use and avoid when resistance surfaces.

In addition, we know that 2023 is halfway over, but there is still time to make impact. Right now, XYZ is offering a 30% discount on any new statement of work signed by June 30, 2023. If there is anything that you need or any program that you're curious about, let me know. I'd be happy to help you.

I hope that you're having a lovely Spring and look forward to speaking with you soon!

<PERSON>

XYZ

activities.subject: Boost cultural literacy at the <PERSON> organization in 2024?
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>, I'm sorry about the <PERSON>' exit from the playoffs, I was definitely rooting for them!

Second, I wanted to let you know of a special promotion we have going on right now (through Dec), where you get a 20% discount on our identity-specific Spotlights when you buy a package for 2024, if you're thinking about additional 2024 programming right now.

It's an opportunity to engage in authentic, yearlong cultural literacy upskilling around the cultures that members of the <PERSON> organization (and its fans) belong to and are influenced and inspired by.

Our culture-specific Spotlights are not superficial.

These one-hour, interactive, deep-dive workshops are focused on the experience of being a member of these communities, and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills, and a culture of belonging throughout the company.


Spotlight on:
Suggested Delivery Month in 2024
1
Black/African American Community
February (Black History Month)
2

3

Both people managers and individual contributors consistently find these sessions relevant and applicable for their workplace goals and relationships, as they include topics like:

  *   Relevant statistics and data that communicate this community's makeup, impact, and experiences
  *   The community's values, priorities, strengths
  *   Dispelling any myths or stereotypes about the community
  *   Challenges or barriers members of this group tend to face in the workplace, and
  *   Strategies & tips for what participants can do to broaden inclusion and belonging for members of this community.

You can save 20% when you purchase our nine workshops when you pay up front - a total of $22,800.

I'm happy to schedule a time to discuss - if this fits into your plans at all!

Best, <PERSON><PERSON>

XYZ

activities.subject: XYZ Proposal - ELearning, MicroLearnings, & IDI Details
activities.body:
Good Morning <PERSON>,

It was a pleasure to talk with you last week to learn more about you and BEFCOR’s internal training opportunities!

I wanted to share a small bit of research based on what you said at the end of the call. We talked briefly about how traveling internationally can aid in connecting across differences. A conference session I attended this year was called “Multiple Pathways to Intercultural Competence in the COVID-era” by Dr. <PERSON> who discussed how you can connect across differences without international experiences. She mentioned that four key elements to support social diversity and relationships were:


  *   Equal Status
  *   Meaningful goals
  *   Support from authority
  *   The opportunity for cooperation

I loved Dr. Peifer’s<<URL>> talk and thought you would too given our discussion on the intersections of interculturalism and DEI!

I’ve attached XYZ’s proposal for e-learning, micro-learning, and IDI assessment options. Could we set up some time next week to see if you have any questions about the programs? Here’s a few times that we are available:


  *   Tuesday, May 16th at 2pm EST
  *   Wednesday, May 17th at 1pm EST
  *   Thursday, May 18th at 11am EST

Let me know if any of those times work for you and we look forward to touching base soon!

activities.subject: Why is AAPI Heritage Month in May?
activities.body:
Dear Kimberly,

Have you ever wondered why AAPI Heritage Month is celebrated in May? 
In 1978, US Congress created an observation week to commemorate the first <NRP> immigrants arriving in the <LOCATION> in May of 1843 as well as the completion of the transcontinental railroad on May 10, 1869. In 1992, the observance was expanded to a month, and the census distinguished <NRP> and <NRP> for the first time. We celebrate this month to acknowledge the history and accomplishments of the AAPI community and stand against the upsurge in coronavirus-related xenophobia seen heavily in the past 3 years. As an educational resource in your authentic allyship, we would like to share a link to last year’s podcast on Supporting Colleagues of Asian & Pacific Islander Descent:

Thank you for your proposal in response to our RFP for DEI Services.

We very much appreciated all the thoughtful work you put into creating your proposal, as well as your interest in working with <LOCATION>.

It is clear that you and your team have a lot of expertise in this area, however, XYZ will not be moving forward as a finalist in our selection process.

activities.subject: RE: Let's catch up on DEI trends - quick call?
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

I wanted to follow up on my email from last week. I am looking to schedule a brief 20-30 minute call to discuss the current challenges to inclusive leadership and management programs and how our other clients are working to ensure an inclusive workplace that maintains their company's values.

I'd love to hear what you folks are thinking about and what you're planning/doing. I can share with you the trends I am hearing from other clients and how XYZ can help your organization succeed across differences.

Schedule time: Use this link <<URL>>

I look forward to connecting.

activities.subject: Let's catch up on DEI trends - quick call?
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

I hope this email finds you well and enjoying the new year.  I am reaching out to a few valued clients and prospects-past and present-to schedule a brief listening session about DEI at their organizations.

There is a lot of discourse about DEI right now and much of it is unhelpful to people charged with solving complex people dynamics in the workplace. I'd love to spend a few minutes chatting about what's happening in the space these days. I'm eager to hear about your employee lifecycle challenges, your insights, and share some of the trends we're seeing with our clients.

Would you be open to a brief call next week? I promise to keep it short and valuable.

Let me know if you have 15-30 minutes to spare - I'll be happy to work around your schedule. Below is my <NRP> link if you want to find the best time for you.

<URL>

Looking forward to reconnecting!

activities.subject: RE: Thank you
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,
Thank you very much for your follow up e-mail. I can appreciate the request for feedback as I am always one looking to grow and learn from it as well.

We were impressed by your in-depth audit and assessment process and liked that it would result in recommendations and a roadmap. However, we didn't feel like there were enough details around what the training program would look like that we included in our RFP. This would include details about the cohorts (what the training program would look like and how often they would meet), what opportunities would be available to further learning after the initial training, and what would an onboarding program look like for new staff. We also received an updated budget that was significantly less than your proposal, resulting in us needing to go in a different direction.

Again, we very much appreciated the effort that went into creating the proposal and your interest in working with <LOCATION>.

I worked with Unilever in the past, delivering those same UB workshops in various locations, including Supermarkets & CCD in <LOCATION>, plants in <LOCATION> and <PERSON>, <LOCATION>, and Ben & Jerry's at the <LOCATION> factory outside <LOCATION> (where I was incredibly lucky to taste ice cream straight off the line!). I also facilitated Black and Latinx cultural immersions for Unilever at HQ a few times.

I consider <PERSON> one of my mentors, have known him and worked alongside him since 2014, although we'd worked together on projects for years before that. I also worked under <PERSON> since 2006.

At any rate, if you are still looking for partnership around DEI for JDE Coffee, or just want to talk some things out, we'd be delighted to meet with you.

Best!
<PERSON><PERSON> (she/her)
Head of Business Development
XYZ

activities.subject: XYZ Follow Up - Navigating Global Cultures
activities.body:
Dear <PERSON>,

We are simply delighted that we had the opportunity to connect with you. It makes us all quite happy to hear that there is such an appetite for cultural competence training, and we would love to partner with you on this initiative. We're eager to connect you with our colleague, <PERSON>, who is copied on this email. <PERSON> will be an essential partner to you to both curate a program that meets your organization's unique needs and to finalize a scope of services that meets your learning goals and opportunities to scale.

I include a link to a quote: <URL> that includes high-level pricing. There are a number of factors that will impact the final costs, and that is why including <PERSON> early in the process is important. After our next meeting, we will provide our recommended scope of work and pricing. The attached pdf also includes an overview of the Navigating Global Cultures program, as well as information on a few of the other programs that we discussed. We look forward to talking through all of these things with you in more detail in the days to come.

I know that <PERSON> shared a few potential meeting dates. Do any of those suggestions work for you? If not, please share a few options and we'll coordinate schedules.

We look forward to speaking with you again soon!

Because we always aim to grow and learn, is there any feedback that you can share with us? It would be helpful to know how we can improve for future submissions.

activities.subject: Thank you
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON> and <PERSON>,

Thank you for your proposal in response to our RFP for DEI Services.

We very much appreciated all the thoughtful work you put into creating your proposal, as well as your interest in working with <LOCATION>.

It is clear that you and your team have a lot of expertise in this area, however, XYZ will not be moving forward as a finalist in our selection process.

Again, we very much appreciated your interest and look forward to another opportunity in the future to potentially work with you.

activities.subject: RE: Let's catch up on DEI trends - quick call?
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

I wanted to follow up on my email from last week. I am looking to schedule a brief 20-30 minute call to discuss the current challenges to inclusive leadership and management programs and how our other clients are working to ensure an inclusive workplace that maintains their company's values.

I'd love to hear what you folks are thinking about and what you're planning/doing. I can share with you the trends I am hearing from other clients and how XYZ can help your organization succeed across differences.

Schedule time: Use this link <<URL>>

I look forward to connecting.

activities.subject: Let's catch up on DEI trends - quick call?
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

I hope this email finds you well and enjoying the new year.  I am reaching out to a few valued clients and prospects-past and present-to schedule a brief listening session about DEI at their organizations.

There is a lot of discourse about DEI right now and much of it is unhelpful to people charged with solving complex people dynamics in the workplace. I'd love to spend a few minutes chatting about what's happening in the space these days. I'm eager to hear about your employee lifecycle challenges, your insights, and share some of the trends we're seeing with our clients.

Would you be open to a brief call next week? I promise to keep it short and valuable.

Let me know if you have 15-30 minutes to spare - I'll be happy to work around your schedule. Below is my <NRP> link if you want to find the best time for you.

<URL>

Looking forward to reconnecting!

activities.subject: RE: Thank you
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,
Thank you very much for your follow up e-mail. I can appreciate the request for feedback as I am always one looking to grow and learn from it as well.

We were impressed by your in-depth audit and assessment process and liked that it would result in recommendations and a roadmap. However, we didn't feel like there were enough details around what the training program would look like that we included in our RFP. This would include details about the cohorts (what the training program would look like and how often they would meet), what opportunities would be available to further learning after the initial training, and what would an onboarding program look like for new staff. We also received an updated budget that was significantly less than your proposal, resulting in us needing to go in a different direction.

Again, we very much appreciated the effort that went into creating the proposal and your interest in working with <LOCATION>.

activities.subject: RE: XYZ Facilitated Training
activities.body:
High level, I am looking at an offering to cover the following for our TC leaders initially in June and August.  Sample outline of what I'd like to accomplish:


  *   Outcomes
     *   People understand and appreciate what DEI is and why it is a business focus.
     *   Learners understand the concept of implicit bias, how it's measures and the harm it creates.
     *   People learn about themselves and where they can take steps to improve.
     *   People learn new strategies to improve and commit to 1-2 actions/strategies they will begin to employ to improve their own efforts to understand and include in the workplace and life.
  *   Timing Wave 1:  June - July
  *   Audience: TC People Leaders, FST
  *   "Unconscious Bias and Prejudice Habit-Breaking"  Outline
     *   Teach what DEI is and why Imagine is focused on this within our culture and for our business.
     *   Teach what implicit bias is, how it's measured, and how it harms women and people of color.
     *   Take the Implicit Association Test, which demonstrates that we all fall prey to unconscious bias to a degree and provide feedback on their personal level of bias.
     *   Teach how to overcome bias through a combination of strategies, including calling out stereotyped views, gathering more individualized information about people, reflecting on counterstereotypical examples, adopting the perspectives of others, and increasing interactions with different kinds of people.
     *   Ask participants to come up with examples of how they could use above strategies in their own lives. Reinforce that strategies support one another and that the more they're practiced, the more effective they will be.

Looking for optional approaches and pricing. LMK if you have questions.

Initial call with <PERSON>, <PERSON> and <PERSON> with <PERSON> Winters (<URL>) and <PERSON> (<URL>).referred by <PERSON>.UpGlo is looking to scale and codify their coaching curriculum.  Approx 30 coaches that are affiliated with any one of their 4 regional offices across the <URL>eir main objective is to empower economic inclusion by supporting skilled and professional immigrants (jobseekers) obtain and retain careers in the <LOCATION>.  They serve approx 1000 refugees and immigrants per year and are looking to scale to 5000.  They intend to partner with 3 verticals : 1) community colleges 2) refugee support systems. 3) ?  They have procedural  and on line resources for onboarding coaches and job seekers.  They mostly train coaches through shadowing and on line resources and are looking to expand the curriculum and standardize and systematize their curriculum for use not just within Up Glo but also with their verticals.We have signed an NDA. Up Glo has provided us with <PERSON> assessment and coaching protocols they ahve in place.  we offered the SCI as a ptoential tool to help [rovide a framework for the curriculum per <PERSON> request.  However, meeting two, they confirmed they are only going to focus on the coaching curriclum.  They are in the process of creating a scope of work document which we should have by June 9, 2023.  <PERSON>, we will submit a proposal

1/8/20024 CALL NOTESClient: Lorenzo VanelliXYZ: <PERSON>, RP, MonicaLorenzo would be the main POC for this projectAlisa gave background on XYZ, highlighted her refugee statusLorenzo was a job seeker 40 years agoMonica intro’d herself and laid the groundwork around our strengths and that we want to test whether we’d be a good fit given where we bring valueLorenzo:2 types of coaching audiences:  Internal – 35 coaches , direct services, part of our program teams, 1-1 with jobseekers, avg tenure around 2-3 years, some focus on certain industries, some more general. Main industries of focus: financial, IT, healthcare, engineering/architecture, running a business (“business logistics and operations” – includes all business support fxns).  Everything else is served by generalist coaches. One lead/exp’d coach in each of the areas, have a community of practice to share thoughts and best practices. Jobseekers are onboarded, go through an online baseline training (fundamentals of jobseeking in <LOCATION>, what to expect in interviews), and then they’re assigned to a coach depending on availability, location (geog area esp re: timezones and connecting to local opp’s), alignment of industry of jobseeker, sometimes by country of origin (e.g., Afghanistan).External – We provide svcs to other org’s who are similar to UpGlo who work with refugees with job seeking in the <LOCATION>. Could also be government agencies, community colleges, non profits, or a library system. Set up or improve or expand their workforce dev and career services. To develop their coaches (online and 1-1 trainings/meetings), barriers they face and how to address, cultural <URL>ernal and External coaches continually learn from each <URL>ree models – Internal standard, guided model (internal reduced/condensed version), and ExternalMonica: Measurement and evaluation: what are you doing right now? And what are the outcomes you’re looking for?Lorenzo: diff ppl at <LOCATION> may have different answers to this! Now, based on 2 main things:1         Placement (and type of placement, FT or PT, $ to ensure it’s fair), tracking placement is very difficult bc connections with them sometimes falls through.2         Whether the jobseeker is “served” – still defining what that is. Provided resources, provided each service on a timely <URL>nsidering measuring around: Are people happy with the services they’re receiving? Almost like a NPS. I created a tool to capture the experience of recent alumni in 2022. Did one round of it, but haven’t found a way to fully integrate it into our <URL><PERSON>: What does success look like?·         <PERSON> set of shared documents (a ‘manual’) that states what frameworks we’re referring to, give examples.·         M&E tools and how to use them.·         Instructional Resources Development – improving and polishing what we haveA portion of budget is tied to a grant that ends in the end of April (funded by Cisco), but have another budget that we could use.Our value and opportunity lies in looking thru things from a cultural competence lens, for global audiences and cross-cultural success. We have instructional design expertise on these topics. What are the topics and current content of the coaching experience? Is it how to succeed in a <LOCATION> audience and interviews with <NRP>? Is it technical role substance? Something else?Lorenzo: No need to dive deeper, the coaching is around general approaches to job search in <LOCATION>, no industry specific technical <URL>mmary of what UG needs:<PERSON> (which just means pedagogy, but for Adults!) Framework:Deliverable: Short, concise document that briefly outlines main adult-learning practices and frameworks and how UpGlo can use them. Document skills and learning objectives that define each step of the jobseeking coaching journey, and what coaches need to enable their work. UpGlo has examples tied to the way they’re already doing it, they already have some ideas, which they will share with <URL>tting up an Instructional Resources Process:Deliverable: Similar to the above, show them options for designing the coaching training manual (for example, <PERSON> vs. <PERSON>) and in practice what would it look like within the constraints of their resources and time. Also, what does the versioning cycle look like, what’s the ideal vs. the in-practice realistic version. A short practice-oriented document. Sounded like, what is our recommendations for what the process should be for them to design the coaching training/<URL>asurement & Evaluation –Deliverable: Recommendations for how to monitor effectiveness of, and evaluate the coaching program. UpGlow said that they have some tools to collate KPI’s but they want to strengthen them. What questions are we asking and how are we using the results? Really doing sth with the insights/information so they don’t just sit <URL>elopment of Instructional Resources: (this sounds like the biggest piece)Deliverable: Collaborate with UpGlo to <NRP> and improve the materials they have. If we see big gaps, this could involve collaborating on building some new content, but it wouldn’t be anything big due to time constraints (e.g., we’re not building Articulate Rise in 3 months for example). They already have cultural competent resources, we’d examine them. We want to continually improve. If we see large gaps that would be a longer term project.  We’re about to hire a instructional designer who will work with XYZ in our small project team. Examples of instructional resources: decks, pdfs, email templates, 1on1 or group session agendas, online micro courses developed in Articulate Rise 360 (primarily text and visual based, no videos or voiceover), assessment materials.Certification Evaluation:Deliverable: a document that shows our recommendations for how to create a certification program of their coaching program (so they can certify people in other organizations on it). They’re starting with ‘no knowing how this work’ and want to know what are the options, how they should it up. What are the options and what are the pros and cons of each <URL><PERSON> asked: are you more focused on cultural competence or instructional design? Instructional design, with some CC.Lorenzo:We understand that it’s possible that there isn’t one vendor that might have subject matter expertise on everything in this RFP. It could be that we have different vendors for each section. Depending on the strengths of each vendor.Would like to do this by the end of April, could be 3-4 months after that.2 tiers: Budget depends on level of detail·         $200k·         $350k (longer term)Can we see what the coaching content / training manual looks like?10:01am: RP had to go to another client call and missed the last part of the meeting…

Working with your current and future leaders sounds like a remarkable opportunity. activities.subject: XYZ Follow Up - Navigating Global Cultures
activities.body:
Dear <PERSON>,

We are simply delighted that we had the opportunity to connect with you. It makes us all quite happy to hear that there is such an appetite for cultural competence training, and we would love to partner with you on this initiative. We're eager to connect you with our colleague, <PERSON>, who is copied on this email. <PERSON> will be an essential partner to you to both curate a program that meets your organization's unique needs and to finalize a scope of services that meets your learning goals and opportunities to scale.

I include a link to a quote: <URL> that includes high-level pricing. There are a number of factors that will impact the final costs, and that is why including <PERSON> early in the process is important. After our next meeting, we will provide our recommended scope of work and pricing. The attached pdf also includes an overview of the Navigating Global Cultures program, as well as information on a few of the other programs that we discussed. We look forward to talking through all of these things with you in more detail in the days to come.

I know that <PERSON> shared a few potential meeting dates. Do any of those suggestions work for you? If not, please share a few options and we'll coordinate schedules.

We look forward to speaking with you again soon!

I'm reaching out to see if you've had a chance to look at the attached proposal or quote<<URL>> for XYZ regarding Navigating Global Cultures that we sent over this week. No problem, if not!

We have 2 full weeks coming up at XYZ including an All Staff retreat so I'm checking in to see if we could schedule a meeting in late May/early June. Here's a few dates that work for <PERSON>, <PERSON>, and myself:

Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you soon!

activities.subject: XYZ Follow Up - Navigating Global Cultures
activities.body:
Dear <PERSON>,

We are simply delighted that we had the opportunity to connect with you. It makes us all quite happy to hear that there is such an appetite for cultural competence training, and we would love to partner with you on this initiative. We're eager to connect you with our colleague, <PERSON>, who is copied on this email. <PERSON> will be an essential partner to you to both curate a program that meets your organization's unique needs and to finalize a scope of services that meets your learning goals and opportunities to scale.

I include a link to a quote<<URL>> that includes high-level pricing. There are a number of factors that will impact the final costs, and that is why including <PERSON> early in the process is important. After our next meeting, we will provide our recommended scope of work and pricing. The attached pdf also includes an overview of the Navigating Global Cultures program, as well as information on a few of the other programs that we discussed. We look forward to talking through all of these things with you in more detail in the days to come.

I know that <PERSON> shared a few potential meeting dates. Do any of those suggestions work for you? If not, please share a few options and we'll coordinate schedules.

We look forward to speaking with you again soon!

activities.subject: RE: Mastery Conference Follow-up
activities.body:

No problem. I’ll continue to hold all 3 dates until we have a confirmed date and time. Other travel accommodations look great. And once we have the SOW signed, let’s get some time on the calendar to review a first draft of the session content.

Until then,
Tamara

activities.subject: RE: Mastery Conference Follow-up
activities.body:
Hello,

We do not know the exact day or time yet, only that it would be august 8,9 or 10. Whatever the time of day, you can expect to be done facilitating no later than 5pm (no sessions after that.) That said, when I have more details I can give you a clearer picture of the day and as well as possible options for having dinner with us after.

For the hotel, I am going to work with our conference team to book you. It will be at the Westin Kierland (so <LOCATION>, no <PERSON>) We can provide mileage at the IRS rate and meals during the conference, and you can submit receipts for meals during travel.

Is this acceptable? If so, can we add this to the contract?

activities.subject: RE: Mastery Conference Follow-up

<PERSON>

Working with your current and future leaders sounds like a remarkable opportunity. We love hearing that Insight has created space for individuals to explore their leadership style with culture, inclusiveness, and adaptability in mind.

As we mentioned, we are eager to connect you with <PERSON> to ideate on both content and format for the break-out session. Knowing that you have a quick turnaround to secure budget, we've created a cost proposal for your review. After you meet with <PERSON>, and if the proposed costs are acceptable, she will prepare a formal Statement of Work. 

INSIGHT - Mastery Conference Proposal: <URL> 

I know that we have a call on the book in about a week, but if you need to meet sooner, let us know. We'll be happy to coordinate a call.

activities.body:
This is great! I would love to set up a meeting with y'all and our Talent Director who is in charge of <LOCATION> to talk through some details. Before I share the proposal with her, I was wondering if you could add some specific language that will increase your proposals alignment to our current work.

Would you mind updating the goals to include integrating Ulteig's Inclusion In Action Framework when discussing inclusive behaviors?
Also, would you mention "dialoguing" when discussing inclusive behaviors.

Does this work for you?

I'll get back to you with some potential meeting times.

Thanks so much!
<PERSON>



[Ulteig Engineers, Inc.]<

activities.subject: XYZ & Ulteig Follow Up
activities.body:
External Sender Warning! Before you reply, click, or open any attachments, ask yourself: Am I expecting this email? Do I recognize the sender? Does it look suspicious? Please proceed with caution!
<PERSON>,

I appreciate your patience as our team worked to create an investment overview for your upcoming Leadership Summit. We were keen to develop a solution that fell within your budget, and to do so we strategized a creative approach and received approval from our leadership team to offer it to you today.

<PERSON>, <PERSON>, and I are eager to partner with you and support the work that Ulteig is doing to create an equitable, inclusive workplace. We are thrilled that you have the opportunity to upskill members of Ulteig's leadership team and recognize the significant impacts that this effort can have within your organization.

We are proposing an interactive workshop where your leaders will:

  *   Create a shared understanding of the importance of inclusive leadership and how it connects with the growing opportunities at Ulteig.
  *   Explore strategies that support people managers in bridging the gap between those representing the newer employees with long-tenured contributors to the organization.
  *   Identify and discuss key inclusive behaviors of people managers, and offer practice opportunities for individual understanding of how these behaviors apply to one's leadership style.
To access the proposal, please click here: Ulteig Leadership Development Summit<<URL>>.

We would love to set up a call next week to answer any questions that you might have and discuss next steps. Looking at calendars, are you available next Tuesday at 4:00 EST? If not, what day works best for you?

We look forward to seeing you again soon.

activities.note_body: 6/20/23Attendees: Annie & MandiXYZ Attendees: Andrea & PedroIntroductions, <PERSON> is a new contact for us. <PERSON>: Talent Director 4 year anniversaryMandi helps lead DEI and recruitmentMandi spoke about the Leader Summit, <NRP> leadership, how to be a developmental leader. <PERSON> is now planning the 2nd leader summit, they are making shifts in the org. <PERSON>, wants to talk about how their employees can appreciate differences from a cultural <URL><PERSON>'s main goal, tying it to our inclusive behaviors, the leaders are role models for everyone else. <PERSON> just created course work on belonging for the leadership roles, to give insights on what they have already done or will have before the summit meeting. For <PERSON> is important to use DEI as a tool for discussion for those that still don't understand their work in inclusion space. <PERSON> provided us with an example, on how one of their leaders made an inappropriate comment and one of the new employees spoke with <PERSON> afterwards about how that comment doesn't represent how the company feels. <PERSON> spoke about how she'd like leaders to be involved in these inclusive <URL><PERSON> mentioned inclusive leadership is so broad. Including specific topics, would be useful. LGBTQ+Andrea spoke about dimensions of differences & Culture and <URL><PERSON> mentioned different framing could reach different people. <PERSON> gave an overview of what's to come. Summit: October 11-12. 12th is the day of this DEI topic. Waiting on next steps, they should have a decision made by end of week!

Ulteig Discovery NotesDate: 3/24/23Attendees: <PERSON> Attendees: Pedro & Melissa·        <PERSON> has been with the company since October 2021.·        She was brought on as the first full time DEI employee.·        She came in with a road map that was developed with consultants and the DEI counsel.·        She spoke of a 3-year plan.·        She mentions they’ve done a lot in the last year and a half.·        <PERSON> mentions that their employee base, diversity wise it isn’t all there. She states 75 percent of the team is white men. 25 percent women, 15 percent people of color. (Broadly)·        <PERSON> said in terms of representation, they still have a lot of work to do.·        Working on building inclusive practices, and making sure everyone has a basic understanding of bias.·        They launched their first employee resource group.·        This year they are launching “4 days of understanding”, CO action.·        May 9th they are having a conversation that’s dedicated towards race.·        June 15th, devoted to gender conversation.·        August topic will be towards disability.·        November topic will be for veterans.·        They have built committees for each one.·        Ideas they are considering, having a virtual listening lounge with different ethnic music that can then come with some discussion. Possible speakers coming in to add more to the conversations.·        Small round table where deep discussions can be held, surrounding topics such as systemic oppression. So these learnings would be celebratory but also provide deep learning.·        Active culture committee.·        They have a liaison between DEI, culture committee, and ERG’s to keep everything coordinated.·        They call all their engagements, bold conversations.·        They have a mixed approach when it comes to what needs to be completed by employees.·        They have 3 levels, optional, recommended, and required.·        She really wants to drive more engagement from their employees.·        1000 employees, she wants at least 40 percent participation.·        She asked about our facilitators, and the types of programs we have that might benefit them.·        Being in the end of March, she mentioned most of her budget dollars are spoken for, for this year.·        She did mention a bit of wiggle room, based around those 4 days of understanding.·        <PERSON> brought up next year and looking to build on what they already have.·        <PERSON> also mentioned they would require a master facilitator who is comfortable with a bit of push back. Someone who is an expert at creating a safe space.
SOW signed on 7/18

First discovery call  - week leading up the <LOCATION>. <PERSON> - has been at company since oct 2021. First full time DEI employee.  Came in with a roadmap  - has a DEI council.  She mentioned that the past year is when they started. The employee base is not there - 25% women - 15% of color. In terms of representation they need a lot of work. They launcehed their first ERG.  This year - they are launching four days of understanding - May 9th - conversation dedicated to race. June 15 - gender - August - disability - Fall - veteransVirtual listening lounge - create discussions for folks - speakers - create three levels of training -optional, recommended, and required level. 1000 employees are aiming for 40% participation.

activities.note_body: Date:  6/15/2023Client: Hope ChicagoClient Participants: <PERSON> HallXYZ Participants: <PERSON>, <PERSON> Notes: AK: Genesis Work – provide internship and career opportunities, personal background, refugee, grew up in <LOCATION>, importance of cultural competence. We are a 23 year-old culture focused, trainings e-learnings can be delivered in any language. CH: I’m on the fundraising team. I’m on this call because I’m a part of our staff retreat planning group. We are late to the game for getting this retreat planned, I’m late to making it happen and seeing if this is a good fit.  Can I give you some background? AK: Of course! CH: Founded in 2021, we are a start-up with 22 people. Grown significantly. Organizational partners, grown quickly. Small team with a lot of movement from the start. We work primarily with black and latino families and kids. Everyone here is mission-focued. We did one staff retreat last year, we’re building another one last year. Our team is pretty diverse, represents the population we work with. The black and latino communities are very different, especially when it comes to family relations, lots of latino parents are undocumented. Vision is we don’t want to rely on our staff members. Ideally, some sort of training that focuses on both communities. “What language are we using to describe in both communities”. Does that resonate with you and something you know how to do? AK: What I’d like to do to give a roadmap. First question: last minute, can it be supported? Yes. Facilitator <PERSON> is in <LOCATION>. We can support that close to the date. What we focus in on is focus. How large is your executive team? CH: 5-6 AK: Where we know where to start with folks. We meet people where we start – prior to the retreat, facilitate an assessment, debrief, going into retreat. What I need to be aware of myself. Systems and pieces in place. Then, during the retreat, <PERSON> will lead a spotlight. Culture native and cultural ally. Why we change behaviors is because CH: Haven’t done this training before. Does <PERSON> work for both culture natives? AK: No, but we would work with you to find the right people. CH: We could bring in each person separately. AK: Each come in different packages – 4 hours, 2 hours. “white glove” CH: Budget – we don’t have a set budget, only because we’ve done one staff retreat before. Do you have a price range for a half day of training. AK: Are you looking for us to do a multi-staff training? Or is it only for executives. What are the expectations on how you’d like us to work with you. CH: The idea of starting at square 1, how does the IDI executive part work. Online? [Importance of IDI] AK: Assessment they do on their own time, the debriefs need folks there. CH: As a next step, would someone schedule a meeting with our retreat planning team? AK: Absolutely. Training between 24th and 27th in July – Monday - Thursday -half day training-IDIs-E-learnings
