activities.subject: Introducing Our Enhanced Cross Cultural Learning Partner Program
activities.body:
Hello Anna,​ 

I hope you're doing well. I wanted to follow up on my previous email regarding our Cross Cultural Learning Partner (CCLP) program, as I understand things can get busy. 

To quickly recap, the CCLP program is an innovative and personalized DEI training designed to foster deeper cultural understanding and sustained growth. The Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) Assessment is a crucial tool within the CCLP program, helping participants not only identify where they are in terms of intercultural competence but also guiding them through the phases of development. Here's how it elevates the training experience: 
Understanding Key Developmental Phases: Throughout the program, participants will navigate various phases of intercultural development, progressing from a primarily monocultural perspective to a more inclusive intercultural viewpoint. This understanding is essential for fostering inclusive environments and navigating cultural differences effectively. Targeted Growth: By taking the IDI assessment at the beginning of the program, participants establish a clear baseline of where they currently stand in their intercultural development journey. We follow up with post IDI assessments as well conducted at the end of the program. This allows us to clearly measure the progress they've made, highlighting the growth in their ability to navigate and understand cultural differences more effectively over the 6-12 month program. We’d love to set up a time to discuss how the IDI assessment and the CCLP program can be implemented to meet your team’s needs. Please let me know what week works best, and I can send over some times to connect. 

Looking forward to your response.

activities.subject: Exclusive Invitation to Participate in XYZ's climate Interview
activities.body:
Dear Lissa,​

Over the past 24 years of working with organizations like yours, we have learned the impact internal and external climates have on our clients doing the work to support inclusion within their organizations. These past few years have truly been filled with change, directional shifts, and future uncertainty. We understand the importance of being a true partner and are excited to announce our exclusive initiative to support our stakeholders by conducting a comprehensive climate interview and survey. The goal of the survey will be to assess how the mindsets and systems within organizations have influenced organizational climate over the past few years and impacted inclusive workplaces. The information we collect from the interview and survey will be treated with utmost confidentiality and the key takeaways will be shared with all selected participants. Based on the key takeaways, we will be sharing relevant resources, developing new content, providing action steps, and offering opportunities to learn and collaborate with peers. 

Please select the time that works best for a 30-minute interview: <URL>

Thank you for considering this opportunity. We look forward to your participation and serving as a continued resource to you and your organization.

activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

We’re excited to share details about our upcoming Spotlight session preview, Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace, scheduled for November 13th at 1-2pm CT / 2-3pm EST.

This session will offer invaluable insights and practical strategies for fostering a more inclusive work environment, particularly for neurodivergent team members. Here’s what you can expect to learn:
Key definitions, models, and vocabulary that will help your team better understand the experiences of neurodivergent colleagues Exploration of shared cultural experiences and challenges that neurodivergent individuals often face in the workplace Proven strategies to create an inclusive environment where all neurological variations are respected and celebrated Practical inclusion skills you can apply immediately to make your workplace more welcoming to neurodivergent team members Whether you're looking to enhance your organization’s intercultural competence or create a more inclusive and supportive environment, this session provides a great opportunity to build understanding and take actionable steps toward fostering true inclusion for all.

activities.subject: Elevate Engagement and Collaboration in 2025 with XYZ’s <LOCATION>!
activities.body:
Hi Lissa,​

As you look ahead to 2025, we’re excited to introduce XYZ’s lineup of <LOCATION>—a series of 75-minute dynamic, interactive virtual trainings designed to foster engagement, support effective collaboration, and enhance intercultural competence across your organization. These sessions delve into key areas such as inclusive leadership, building cultural competence, collaborating across generations, and neurodiversity inclusion in the workplace. Each of these sessions provides practical strategies for teams to work more cohesively in today’s diverse environments.

Whether your goal is to drive engagement, inclusion, or cultural literacy, our <LOCATION> are a flexible resource that can be tailored to fit your organization’s unique goals.

Take a look at our Miniworkshop Sessions Overview: <URL> where you'll see the breadth of topics we cover (we can custom-build one for you too!).

We’d love to discuss how these sessions could align with your 2025 learning goals.

Looking forward to connecting!

activities.subject: REGISTER FOR FREE PREVIEW: Spotlights on the <NRP> & Jewish Communities in the <LOCATION>
activities.body:
Hi Lissa,​

As part of our ongoing commitment to fostering cultural understanding and promoting inclusion, we’re excited to announce an upcoming no-cost session previewing our two new programs: "Spotlight on the Jewish Community in the <LOCATION>" and "Spotlight on the Muslim Community in the <LOCATION>." The preview will take place on May 29th, 2024 from 2-3pm ET / 1-2pm CT. 

These two additions to our Spotlights library were carefully designed and vetted by interculturalists and culture-expert members of the <NRP> and <NRP> community. Facilitated by two cross-cultural expert facilitators (one a member of the community and one ally), the Spotlights provide participants with valuable insights into the histories, values, experiences, and influences that shape each of these distinct cultures, and deliver an insightful and nuanced understanding of the <NRP> and <NRP> experiences in <LOCATION> - dispelling misconceptions and fostering empathy. These sessions do not explain or resolve current geopolitical events, do not advocate particular points of view or debate history, and like all of our Spotlights, aim to build cultural competence and understanding. 

The Spotlights helps participants: 
Explore factors that have shaped the lived experiences and cultural values of the community in the <LOCATION>, including shared experiences and common influences. Recognize the depth and diversity of the community in the <LOCATION> Discuss historical and contemporary prejudice against the community. Explore strategies to support and be an ally to your colleagues and the community at large. In our preview we’ll demonstrate sample content from both Spotlights, show you the agenda for each, and answer your questions. 

REGISTER FOR THE SPOTLIGHTS PREVIEW:
Wednesday, May 29th, 2024 from 2-3pm ET / 1-2pm CT Register Here: <URL> 

We believe that these Spotlights can be valuable tools which, in conjunction with other elements of your DEI infrastructure, work towards de-polarization and enhancing participants’ ability to engage meaningfully with individuals from these backgrounds. 

We're looking forward to seeing you there!

activities.subject: New XYZ Spotlight: Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace
activities.body:
Hi Lissa,​ 

Following up on my last message about our Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace, I wanted to share how this training, along with our other Spotlights focused on the rich communities that shape every organization, can equip your team with skills they can apply right away. 

This session covers: 
Practical inclusion strategies that your team can start using immediately to support neurodivergent colleagues. Real-world examples and insights into the cultural experiences of neurodivergent people. Tools and resources to foster a more inclusive, respectful, and innovative workplace. I would like to schedule time to share some of these resources with you, learn about your current initiatives and answer any questions. Please let me know when is best for us to connect. We are confident this session could bring valuable insights to your team! 

Looking forward to your thoughts.

activities.subject: New XYZ Spotlight: Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace
activities.body:
Hi Anna,​

I hope this message finds you well. We’re excited to introduce our latest timely training session, Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace. This 75-minute virtual session, structured similar to our library of spotlights on various communities, is designed to offer valuable insights into the experiences of neurodivergent colleagues and provide practical strategies for fostering an inclusive workplace.

In this session, you’ll:
Learn the terminology and models to better understand neurodivergent experiences. Gain insights into the shared cultural experiences of neurodivergent individuals. Acquire actionable strategies to create an inclusive environment for neurodivergent team members. This course not only dives into the definitions and experiences of neurodivergent people but also helps you build an inclusive culture where every neurological difference is respected and celebrated.

Would you be open to discussing how this training can enhance your team's approach to inclusivity? We’d be happy to schedule a meeting in the next week to explore this further.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

activities.subject: Get Ready for Black History Month
activities.body:
Dear Anna,​

Happy New Year! As we step into 2025, we hope this year brings success, growth, and meaningful connections for you and your team. With Black History Month approaching, it’s the perfect opportunity to reflect, learn, and engage in impactful conversations about diversity and inclusion. At XYZ, we’re here to support your efforts with our engaging Spotlight on the Black/African American Community session.

This 1-hour virtual learning experience offers:
Insight into the history and contributions of the Black/African American community. Strategies for fostering inclusion and allyship within your organization. An interactive format that encourages questions and dialogue. Whether you’re looking to celebrate Black History Month or deepen your organization’s commitment to equity, this session provides actionable tools for change.

Let’s connect to bring this impactful learning to your team. 

Schedule a meeting with us using this calendar link: <URL>

activities.subject: Commemorating Juneteenth & Its Legacy
activities.body:
Dear Lissa,​

Many employers are planning to recognize <LOCATION> this year to celebrate this significant date in <NRP> history. 

<LOCATION>, a federal holiday celebrated annually on June 19th, marks the completion of emancipation of enslaved <NRP> in <LOCATION>, and symbolizes freedom, resilience, and the ongoing struggle for equality.

We believe that it's crucial to take the opportunity to reflect, learn, and engage in meaningful conversations about <LOCATION> and its importance to our employees and clients. To help you facilitate this dialogue, we have developed a one-hour session on this topic.

Our virtual workshop, Understanding <LOCATION> and Its Legacy, has the following objectives:
Explore <LOCATION>’s historical context, its significance in <NRP> history, and how it has evolved over time. Understand how many organizations have historically exploited the holiday. Explore ways in which individuals and organizations can commit to supporting and advocating for <NRP> communities beyond designated months or holidays. We also invite you to sample our “Commemorating Juneteenth” microlearning via this link: <URL> It will remain open and available for you until May 31st. Just enter your email address and name, and you’ll get access.

Understanding the roots of this holiday and its lasting impact is an important element for fostering empathy, awareness, and inclusion. Bringing colleagues together to engage in this opportunity to learn about history and progress has a positive impact in the workplace.

If you’re interested or have any questions, please reply to this email and we can set up a meeting.

Historial elements that have shaped and formed that culture, and then values and behaviors. .―       Then challenges in the workplace.―       Then how colleagues can be allies.―       We grounded the sessions in the US.―       <PERSON> gave a high level overview of the <NRP> Spotlight.―       Facilitators vary depending on the context and design of the <PERSON>       Not to take sides or resolve any geopolitical events. State that up front. Start with the business case, why we’re here.  ―       Played new colossus video, remind folks that <PERSON>Sometimes we fall short of these values – xition to <PERSON>       Poll quiz in <PERSON> slide―       Facts about the <NRP> community―       History, defining antisemitism, brief mention of <NRP> (can be a hot topic but won’t be going into it in this session)―       Culture, <NRP> holiday, <NRP> contributors, <PERSON> musician―       Challenges in the workplace, microaggressions, stereotype threat―       Starting the conversation – quote at the top can be adapted to <NRP>: “This looks great and it hits everything we’re looking for..”Tamara walked thru <NRP> Experience―       Open with great video about ‘secret lives of Muslims’―       Fact or Myth? <PERSON>       <NRP> in the media, <PERSON>       Culture, values, etc.―       Challenges in the workplace, ‘have you planned/participated/or avoided’ poll―       Practices for fostering inclusion – can be tailored or adapted to BCGWhat’s the process? RP talked about virtual, # of fac, cost, flexible in terms of # of partLissa said “You’re one of the firms we recommend for this type of learning”They don’t want to make this a required trainingDo we invite everyone and opt in? I suggested yet, and frame it as an opp to learn some facts about the culture of these communities from BCG’s longtime, trusted <URL>e will relay everything she learned today to other internal stakeholders but she really liked both.

Thanks for reaching out!

Yes, yesterday we held content preview about our new Spotlights on the <NRP>-American and <NRP> communities.

These two additions to our Spotlights library were carefully designed and vetted by interculturalists and culture-expert members of the <NRP> and <NRP> community. Facilitated by two cross-cultural expert facilitators (one a member of the community and one ally), the Spotlights provide participants with valuable insights into the histories, values, experiences, and influences that shape each of these distinct cultures, and deliver an insightful and nuanced understanding of the <NRP> and <NRP> experiences in <LOCATION> - dispelling misconceptions and fostering empathy. These sessions do not explain or resolve current geopolitical events, do not advocate particular points of view or debate history, and like all of our Spotlights, aim to build cultural competence and understanding.

Attached are overviews of the agendas for each 75-min session.

We are absolutely open to working with you to create a <NRP> context-focused version of these sessions. We also have a <LOCATION>-based consultant/facilitator.

Would you like to schedule a meeting, perhaps for next week or the week after?  Also, I’m trying to get a hold of the recording from yesterday’s preview so I can send that to you too… stay tuned….

activities.subject: Introducing Our Enhanced Cross Cultural Learning Partner Program
activities.body:
Hello <PERSON> 

I hope you're doing well. I wanted to follow up on my previous email regarding our Cross Cultural Learning Partner (CCLP) program, as I understand things can get busy. 

To quickly recap, the CCLP program is an innovative and personalized DEI training designed to foster deeper cultural understanding and sustained growth. The Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) Assessment is a crucial tool within the CCLP program, helping participants not only identify where they are in terms of intercultural competence but also guiding them through the phases of development. Here's how it elevates the training experience: 
Understanding Key Developmental Phases: Throughout the program, participants will navigate various phases of intercultural development, progressing from a primarily monocultural perspective to a more inclusive intercultural viewpoint. This understanding is essential for fostering inclusive environments and navigating cultural differences effectively. Targeted Growth: By taking the IDI assessment at the beginning of the program, participants establish a clear baseline of where they currently stand in their intercultural development journey. We follow up with post IDI assessments as well conducted at the end of the program. This allows us to clearly measure the progress they've made, highlighting the growth in their ability to navigate and understand cultural differences more effectively over the 6-12 month program. We’d love to set up a time to discuss how the IDI assessment and the CCLP program can be implemented to meet your team’s needs. Please let me know what week works best, and I can send over some times to connect. 

Looking forward to your response.

Following up on my last message about our Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace, I wanted to share how this training, along with our other Spotlights focused on the rich communities that shape every organization, can equip your team with skills they can apply right away.

activities.subject: Get Ready for Hispanic Heritage Month with XYZ's Spotlight Bundle Offer!
activities.body:
Hi Kelly,​ 

I hope all is well! As you are planning out end of summer initiatives, as well as, strategizing for the next quarter and year, I wanted to share some of the ways we support our clients when it comes to culture focused education initiatives. Below I’ve listed an overview of the type of rollout we see when clients purchase our various Community Spotlight Bundles. Our rollouts are flexible based on your budget. I would like to schedule time with you to learn more about how we can best partner and answer any questions, I’m happy to help! 

Overview of our Spotlight Series: 
The Muslim Community – suggested delivery date, January (Muslim Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) Black/African Community – suggested delivery date, February (Black History month) (1 Facilitator) Women in Leadership – suggested delivery date, March (Women’s History Month) (1 Facilitator) The Jewish Community – suggested delivery date, May (Jewish Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) Being an Ally for the Asian American Community – Suggested delivery date, May (AAPI Heritage month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) The LGBTQ+ Community – suggested delivery date, June (Pride Month) (1 Facilitator) Persons with Disabilities – suggested delivery date, July (Disability Pride Month) (1 Facilitator) The Hispanic Community – suggested delivery date, September (Hispanic Heritage Month) (1 Facilitator) Indigenous People in <LOCATION> – suggested delivery date, October (Indigenous Peoples’ Day) or November (Native American Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) U.S. Veterans Community – suggested delivery date, November (Veterans’ Day) (1 Facilitator) U.S Generations – suggested delivery date, December, April or August (1 Facilitator) Special bundle pricing available for full rollouts. We’d love to connect to share additional resources with you. Let me know what week works best for you and I’ll send over some times. 

Have a great week!

activities.subject: New XYZ Spotlight: Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace
activities.body:
Hi Kelly,​

I hope this message finds you well. We’re excited to introduce our latest timely training session, Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace. This 75-minute virtual session, structured similar to our library of spotlights on various communities, is designed to offer valuable insights into the experiences of neurodivergent colleagues and provide practical strategies for fostering an inclusive workplace.

In this session, you’ll:
Learn the terminology and models to better understand neurodivergent experiences. Gain insights into the shared cultural experiences of neurodivergent individuals. Acquire actionable strategies to create an inclusive environment for neurodivergent team members. This course not only dives into the definitions and experiences of neurodivergent people but also helps you build an inclusive culture where every neurological difference is respected and celebrated.

Would you be open to discussing how this training can enhance your team's approach to inclusivity? We’d be happy to schedule a meeting in the next week to explore this further.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

activities.subject: Introducing Our Enhanced Cross Cultural Learning Partner Program
activities.body:
Dear Kelly,​

I hope this message finds you well. At XYZ, we are always striving to innovate and provide the most impactful solutions for fostering Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion within organizations. With that commitment in mind, we are excited to introduce our updated and elevated training program: The Cross Cultural Learning Partner (CCLP).

What makes our CCLP program stand out from traditional DEI training programs? It’s designed to offer a more personalized, in-depth, and continuous learning experience. Here’s how:
Collaborative Learning: Unlike typical trainings where participants learn individually, CCLP pairs each participant with a learning partner that is culturally different in a significant way. This partnership encourages mutual support and shared growth, making the learning process richer and more effective. The cultural differences between partners offer real, lived scenarios that can be explored through open communication. Extended Engagement: While most DEI sessions are limited to just a few hours, our CCLP program spans 6 to 12 months. This extended timeframe allows for a deeper exploration of cultural competencies, continuous learning, and the opportunity to apply and reflect on insights over time. Real-World Scenarios: CCLP moves beyond hypothetical situations by integrating your unique experiences into the training. This makes the learning more relevant and directly applicable to the challenges and opportunities within your organization. Measurable Growth: Understanding your progress is key to effective learning. CCLP includes pre- and post-assessments, enabling participants to track their development and gain clear insights into how much they’ve grown after the program. We believe that our CCLP program offers a transformative approach to DEI training, and we would love to explore how it can benefit your team or organization. If you’re interested in learning more or setting up a time to discuss further, please don’t hesitate to reach out.

Looking forward to connecting!

activities.subject: Get Ready for Hispanic Heritage Month with XYZ's Spotlight Bundle Offer!
activities.body:
Dear Kelly,​

As Hispanic Heritage Month approaches, now is the perfect time to celebrate and deepen your organization's understanding of the <NRP> community's rich history, culture, and contributions. At XYZ, we are excited to offer our Spotlight on the Hispanic Community, designed to educate and engage your teams in meaningful conversations during this important time. This Spotlight session is available both in English and Spanish.

Our Spotlights are one-hour, interactive, deep-dive workshops that focus on the experience of being a member of these communities, and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills and a culture of belonging throughout the firm.

In addition, we are running a special offer on our Spotlight Bundle, which includes a total of 11 Spotlight sessions. As your teams plan for their 2025 initiatives, our Spotlight Bundle offers an excellent opportunity to ensure a focused and consistent effort to highlight and educate employees about various communities that make up their peers. Whether you're looking to enhance your DEI initiatives or simply want to keep the conversation going, we feel this bundle is a valuable resource for your organization.

Here’s are the names of the other 10 Spotlight sessions: The Jewish Community, The Muslim Community, Black/African Community, Women in Leadership, Being an Ally for the Asian American Community, The LGBTQ+ Community, Persons with Disabilities, Indigenous People in <LOCATION>, U.S. Veterans Community, and U.S Generations.

I’d love to schedule some time to discuss how our Spotlights can align with your goals and enrich your team's understanding of the <NRP> community and beyond. Let me know what week works best for you and I can send over some times to connect.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Cassels offers one of the largest business law practices in <LOCATION>, advising clients from start-ups to multi-national organizations – across the street and around the world. Cassels Brock & Blackwell LLPSuite 3200, Bay Adelaide Centre – <LOCATION>, <LOCATION>, <LOCATION>  M5H 0B4 <LOCATION> After public session, <PERSON> emailed us: Hello! I understand that you facilitated training yesterday around antisemitism and anti-Islamophobia from an <NRP> context. More specifically, delivered an insightful and nuanced understanding of the <NRP> and <NRP> experiences in <LOCATION> -dispelling misconceptions and fostering empathy with an aim to build cultural competence and understanding. I'm curious to know if you intend to facilitate something soon from the <NRP> context or if this is something that your org would be willing to work on with my firm to create. Looking forward to hearing from you. Call notes:This would be firmwide, not just for lawyers – can be 200-300 peopleAlisa mentioned that multiple sessions are preferred so that people get the best experience Around when would you want to schedule these? No idea yet. Need to talk to management first. EDI feels strongly. Probably fall of 2024 because we have other learning sessions scheduled already. Provided <PERSON> with this language: This session will NOT explain nor resolve current geopolitical events, does not take particular points of view, and does not debate history.  What we will do is share how it impacts the day-to-day realities of your <NRP> and <NRP> colleagues, and how you can support them. <PERSON> had a very positive reaction to the walkthrough of both Spotlights, and with our culture focused approach, so we told her about all our library having that approach plus also intercultural competence learning. Having these programs are less risky than those on Islamophobia and Antisemitism, we know the cost of lawsuits if we don’t do a good job of educating our people. activities.subject: Missed Our Neurodiversity Spotlight Preview? Watch the Recording!
activities.body:
Hi Jacquie,​

Thank you for your interest in our recent live preview of the newest XYZ Spotlight session on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace. We’ve heard from other attendees that the session proved to be a catalyst for rich conversations in their organizations, and we're thrilled with the engagement and insights shared.

If you missed the live session—or want to revisit key moments—you can now access the recording!

Spotlight on Neurodiversity in the Workplace: <URL>

This recording is a great resource to:
Catch up on what you missed if you were unable to attend. Share with decision-making leaders and colleagues who couldn’t attend. Reflect on ways to foster more inclusive environments for neurodivergent talent. We believe that this preview will inspire deeper conversations within your team. Let us know if we can connect with you on scheduling sessions for your organization or if you'd like to learn more about our other award-winning, cost-effective training or consulting solutions.

Looking forward to connecting with you!

activities.body:

As you look ahead to 2025, we’re excited to introduce XYZ’s lineup of <LOCATION>—a series of 75-minute dynamic, interactive virtual trainings designed to foster engagement, support effective collaboration, and enhance intercultural competence across your organization. Whether your goal is to drive engagement, inclusion, or cultural literacy, our <LOCATION> are a flexible resource that can be tailored to fit your organization’s unique goals.

Looking forward to connecting!

  1.
Did you share pricing??  For the <NRP> session, <LOCATION> is $1000 - RP shared pricing with client at $4,500 - see above. A <PERSON> session could probably be developed for $2K.  But did we want to position this as something we already have?  Or acknowledge that we have the expertise to create one…? I have said that we have customized this session before for other groups, but I didn't get into the details. Nor did I say we had this ready to go. I did not mention charges for customization. I would position that we have the expertise to <URL>t that we already have this done. But that's just me. I'll leave that to you & Chuck 🙂.

activities.subject: REGISTER FOR COMPLIMENTARY PREVIEW: Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

At XYZ, we’re excited to share details about our upcoming Spotlight session preview, Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace, scheduled for November 13th at 1-2pm CT / 2-3pm EST.

This session will offer invaluable insights and practical strategies for fostering a more inclusive work environment, particularly for neurodivergent team members. Here’s what you can expect to learn:
Key definitions, models, and vocabulary that will help your team better understand the experiences of neurodivergent colleagues Exploration of shared cultural experiences and challenges that neurodivergent individuals often face in the workplace Proven strategies to create an inclusive environment where all neurological variations are respected and celebrated Practical inclusion skills you can apply immediately to make your workplace more welcoming to neurodivergent team members Whether you're looking to enhance your organization’s intercultural competence or create a more inclusive and supportive environment, this session provides a great opportunity to build understanding and take actionable steps toward fostering true inclusion for all.

Register here to reserve your spot:

activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> –

<PERSON> shared your note with me and I wanted to respond to the question asked and the question that I think might be behind the question.

The simple response is that the current course does not address the broader <NRP> population with any specificity… but could. That would require some basic customization. Customizations start at $750, depending on the level of design and development required.

If the core of the question is do we talk about how Islamophobia impacts those who may not be <NRP> but present in ways that people might confuse with being <NRP>, we do. We talk specifically about the effects of discrimination on <NRP> and those perceived to be <NRP> but the course is really anchored in identifying and interrupting <PERSON>, as well as unpacking and exploring the contributions of <NRP> to the culture.

Let me know if you have any additional questions.

<PERSON>Please Note: Honoring the need for work/life balance, XYZ will be closed for Winter Break from December 24 through January 1st. Happy Holidays to you and yours!

<PERSON> (He/Him)
Chief Executive Officer
XYZ

activities.meeting_title: Discuss XYZ <NRP> community and <NRP> community sessions

activities.note_body: Call Notes 6/14/24XYZ Attendees: Alisa & PedroAttendees: Jacquie & DellaJacquie Brown: Program Manager focused on <PERSON>: Global Head of DEIAlisa asked how they heard about us? They put out a note to the ALDMP, DEI alias for legal professionals. <PERSON> thinks we responded on there and that's how things started. <PERSON> starts by mentioning each of our trainings will have a culture native/licensed interculturalist/member of the community. We also provide an ally to serve as a supporter in the training. <PERSON> went over the build. Mentions working with folks from the communities. <PERSON> covered customization options as well. <PERSON> asked how has process or the content changed since October 7th ? <PERSON> mentioned we acknowledge the rise in both Islamophobia as well as antisemitism. Updated sources are <URL><PERSON> covered what the training does not go over, for example we are not having a conversation to address the existing conflict but instead focusing on the complexities of these identities. The training is not leverage as a way to debate topics or choose sides. Training focused on the communities. Della asked what defines a interculturalist? Della asked how do we vet our consultants? Do we monitor what stance they take on their personal social media pages? It's important for them, that the speaker is neutral and that it aligns with their company. Della mentioned she's been asked internally, "what have these speakers said on twitter?" "what have they put out into the ether?" Specially during this time and the conflict between these two <URL>in point: is they want the speakers to have the same values as their org. Aligned with their values. They want to minimize misrepresentation. <PERSON> mentions its less about the content and more about the people. They want to make sure whoever is facilitating, that they have been vetted to make sure they aren't picking sides on social media.<PERSON> asked if we have presented to any law firms yet? and how that went? Next steps: Follow up via email, provide bio on some of our consultants. As well as some examples of who's doing these spotlights. Clients?

Call Notes 7/3/24Attendees: XYZ Attendees: Alisa & PedroPurpose of the call is to show some of content that our two new spotlights <URL><PERSON> gave an overview of the <NRP> SpotlightWhat definition are we using for antisemitism? <PERSON> answered the question. They asked about the chat function? Can it be more private or can it be removed?Alisa mentioned 100 per session. Della then asked how would it work if they go over? <PERSON> suggested more sessions, more available times for folks to attend and stops it from becoming a <URL><PERSON> mentioned we can provide marketing material. <PERSON> wanted to make sure the session isn't just focused on the religion but also the culture of that community. <PERSON> shared overview of the <NRP> Spotlight. <PERSON> asked about going over the slides and seeing the videos?Della mentioned the affinity groups will decide on whether we do this training. Next steps is to show them the actual <URL>lla asked if we had a one pager with our clients on it? <PERSON> mentioned our website to use for references/ case studies. A few slides, that show the approach and help with credibility.
Passed to Andrea 2.13.25

activities.subject: RE: Following up: IDI and workshop description
activities.body:
<PERSON> – thank you for the follow up. Once you share the contract I’ll pass along to our legal team for edits and additions of our standard language, including some of the below. However, see response to the specific flags below:


  *   When we invoice you, is there a PO number or charge code we’ll need to include, and if so, would you be able to provide that to us?
     *   Legal will drop in our standard language: All invoices shall clearly specify the corresponding Property ID#23000, include Department Code 200-18001 – Social Impact, be sent to Link via e- mail to <EMAIL_ADDRESS>,<mailto:<EMAIL_ADDRESS>> and conform to the following: (i) PDF format, size limit 5MB per PDF; (ii) all pages and backup of invoice included in one PDF; (iii) separate PDF for each invoice submitted per e-mail (e-mails can include multiple PDFs); and (iv) each invoice must have a unique number.
  *   What is your invoicing process? Do we send to you and/or <PERSON>, or is there a different person/department?
     *   The above notes the process for email and then you’ll cc <PERSON> to help track.
  *   Finally, what are you payment terms? Our preference is net 30 days as we’re a small business that relies on receiving payment quickly in order to keep running effectively. Would that be okay?
     *   With a new vendor it can be net-45 but we aim for net-30.


Additionally, the below communications are helpful but just a flag there is the likelihood some folks will fill the assessment out late given holiday and just this being a new meeting type – we will of course push hard to avoid this but in the chance, it does is there any alternative plan?

activities.subject: Following up: IDI and workshop description
RE: XYZ Proposal Update and next steps: IDI assessment timeline, description of & communication for sessions
activities.body:
Hello <PERSON>,

In response to <PERSON>’s last email as she is away, as I will be coordinating these sessions here is valuable information:


  1.  You will get IDI assessment description and communication to go your team.
  2.  Each person receiving an assessment will get clear instructions how to access assessment and deadline to complete it.
  3.  Session being July 25 for IDI group debrief session, we usually like to get ALL assessments completed 7-10 days prior to session, so getting all names and emails for the 25 individuals by Monday July 8th would be ideal to give your team 7 days including the weekend to complete the assessment. July 15th sound good as it those who may need a reminder to complete it in ample time. How does that sound?
  4.  You will also receive a separate description of  IDI group debrief session (July 25) and  the BCI session  (August date TBD) to prepare your announcement and invitation to those who will attend the respective sessions. I will send them within 48hrs.

Let me know if you have any questions,

activities.subject: RE: XYZ Proposal Update
activities.body:
Thanks <PERSON>. I’ll provide the list of participants for IDI when I return. Could I please see the language for what the comms / push will look like?

<PERSON> will respond to recording and timing of the 7/25.

Thanks!

[cid:<URL>g@01DACD60.47C99A40]<

activities.subject: RE: XYZ Proposal Update
RE: XYZ Proposal Update
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

We are good to move forward with the proposal. We are also locked in for Thursday, July 25 from 12 to 1:30 PM ET. Please let us know if that works for <PERSON>.  <PERSON> is available between 2-4pm EST on that day. If that time doesn’t work, please let us know and <PERSON> will assign a different Qualified IDI Certified Facilitator.


A few questions –

1)Outside of payment, what else is needed to get the survey sent? We need first /last names and email addresses of the 25 people that will take the IDI assessment.


2) Would it be possible to record any of the trainings? We know this is more of an introductory session, but most clients are scheduling multiple sessions live because; We do believe that the most impactful and enriching learning happens in the live sessions where participants can respond to the materials and ask questions of experienced DEI practitioners about the content. Watching the static recording will not resonate the same for all potential learners. In short, it will be a lesser experience. I also want to ensure that Link Logistics would be okay with recording and distributing to the rest of the organization the comments and questions that might be asked in the safe space of the live session. It will be a dynamic environment. The concern is others taking comments/questions advanced by your staff in the live session out of context or mischaracterizing them for their own partisan purposes. There is risk.

If you still decide that a recording of your session is needed the cost will be as follows:
Weekly access: $2,500 per week
Perpetual access: $25,000 (you will be provided the recording to place on your LMS)
Of course, we would initiate and manage the recording of the session and the subsequent recorded file.

3) Would XYZ also be open to being mentioned in external communications such as our ESG report? YES! OF COURSE. XYZ would also love to promote the ESG report on our own social media too!

I’m cc’ing Grace, department head, who will help run point on any of the PO / invoicing while I’m out next week.

Thanks!

[cid:<URL>g@01DACD60.47C99A40]<

activities.subject: New XYZ Spotlight: Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace
activities.body:
Hi Sandra,​

I hope this message finds you well. We’re excited to introduce our latest timely training session, Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace. This 75-minute virtual session, structured similar to our library of spotlights on various communities, is designed to offer valuable insights into the experiences of neurodivergent colleagues and provide practical strategies for fostering an inclusive workplace.

In this session, you’ll:
Learn the terminology and models to better understand neurodivergent experiences. Gain insights into the shared cultural experiences of neurodivergent individuals. Acquire actionable strategies to create an inclusive environment for neurodivergent team members. This course not only dives into the definitions and experiences of neurodivergent people but also helps you build an inclusive culture where every neurological difference is respected and celebrated.

Would you be open to discussing how this training can enhance your team's approach to inclusivity? We’d be happy to schedule a meeting in the next week to explore this further.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

activities.subject: Re: Issues with SOW2 + meeting this Friday morning
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON> back, in blue my answers.


  1.  I am listed as ‘key personnel’ and project manager. Your main contact will be the XYZ Consultant assigned to the Colgate Palmolive account. This one may not be that big a deal, but wanted to let you know it will not be me.  It's OK, please let us know who is the Consultant assigned to our project.



  1.  The cost of the building of the new microlearning, “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition” is not included in the SOW. This cost was $25k, as detailed in the proposal we shared with you and the XYZ SOW I wrote up and sent y’all on May 6th. The SOW does state “Once Supplier develops a 6th microlearning, ‘Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition’, it will be included in this library total at no additional cost” – which is true as it pertains to the subscription fees, but not the design and development fee of $25k which we had previously discussed. We are NOT targeting this course for this year. A new SOW will be needed in 2025 to create the  “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition” micro learning.



  1.  The SOW says “Edits to pre-existing microlearning courses, as per Company's requests” @ $3500. In the XYZ SOW I sent ion May 6th, I had included a list of the precise edits that we agreed to and priced out for you. This list was not included in the SOW that was signed, instead it says “Edits to pre-existing microlearning courses, as per Company's requests”, leaving it rather open. I know during our recent meetings with our Translation head we talked about this- depending on the extent of any additional changes, there may be an additional cost. The specific changes we had previously agreed to were:

     *   Overall for all microlearnings: Ensure images throughout show broad diversity (gender, race, age, abilities, etc.) and ensure participants cannot skip content.
     *   Managing <PERSON> in Recruiting: Lesson 2: Ensure participants read all items in the 'Things you can say to support inclusive recruiting' thought bubbles.
     *   Managing <PERSON> in Hiring: A. Lesson 1 video: Edit out the phrase "...who in many cases will be women” from voiceover; B. Lesson 2 'Tips for interrupting and mitigating the effects of unconscious bias during the hiring process": Ensure participants read all the tips (1-7) and edit onscreen text in Tip #5 (substitute debate team example with more globally relatable example)
     *   Managing <PERSON> in Interviewing: Lesson 2: In the "What can you do?' section, under “Implicit Stereotyping Bias”, substitute example in fourth bullet

Lesson 2: Replace the image of all the women with an image that is more diverse (currently photo is all women of color – we want to make sure that photo includes white women/people). B. Questioning yourself reflects humility and propels growth.”

activities.subject: Get Ready for Hispanic Heritage Month with XYZ's Spotlight Bundle Offer!
activities.body:
Hi Sandra,​ 

I hope all is well! As you are planning out end of summer initiatives, as well as, strategizing for the next quarter and year, I wanted to share some of the ways we support our clients when it comes to culture focused education initiatives. Below I’ve listed an overview of the type of rollout we see when clients purchase our various Community Spotlight Bundles. Our rollouts are flexible based on your budget. I would like to schedule time with you to learn more about how we can best partner and answer any questions, I’m happy to help! 

Overview of our Spotlight Series: 
The Muslim Community – suggested delivery date, January (Muslim Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) Black/African Community – suggested delivery date, February (Black History month) (1 Facilitator) Women in Leadership – suggested delivery date, March (Women’s History Month) (1 Facilitator) The Jewish Community – suggested delivery date, May (Jewish Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) Being an Ally for the Asian American Community – Suggested delivery date, May (AAPI Heritage month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) The LGBTQ+ Community – suggested delivery date, June (Pride Month) (1 Facilitator) Persons with Disabilities – suggested delivery date, July (Disability Pride Month) (1 Facilitator) The Hispanic Community – suggested delivery date, September (Hispanic Heritage Month) (1 Facilitator) Indigenous People in <LOCATION> – suggested delivery date, October (Indigenous Peoples’ Day) or November (Native American Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) U.S. Veterans Community – suggested delivery date, November (Veterans’ Day) (1 Facilitator) U.S Generations – suggested delivery date, December, April or August (1 Facilitator) Special bundle pricing available for full rollouts. We’d love to connect to share additional resources with you. Let me know what week works best for you and I’ll send over some times. 

Have a great week!

activities.subject: Get Ready for Hispanic Heritage Month with XYZ's Spotlight Bundle Offer!
activities.body:
Dear Jesma,​

As Hispanic Heritage Month approaches, now is the perfect time to celebrate and deepen your organization's understanding of the <NRP> community's rich history, culture, and contributions. At XYZ, we are excited to offer our Spotlight on the Hispanic Community, designed to educate and engage your teams in meaningful conversations during this important time. This Spotlight session is available both in English and Spanish.

Our Spotlights are one-hour, interactive, deep-dive workshops that focus on the experience of being a member of these communities, and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills and a culture of belonging throughout the firm.

In addition, we are running a special offer on our Spotlight Bundle, which includes a total of 11 Spotlight sessions. As your teams plan for their 2025 initiatives, our Spotlight Bundle offers an excellent opportunity to ensure a focused and consistent effort to highlight and educate employees about various communities that make up their peers. Whether you're looking to enhance your DEI initiatives or simply want to keep the conversation going, we feel this bundle is a valuable resource for your organization.

Here’s are the names of the other 10 Spotlight sessions: The Jewish Community, The Muslim Community, Black/African Community, Women in Leadership, Being an Ally for the Asian American Community, The LGBTQ+ Community, Persons with Disabilities, Indigenous People in <LOCATION>, U.S. Veterans Community, and U.S Generations.

I’d love to schedule some time to discuss how our Spotlights can align with your goals and enrich your team's understanding of the <NRP> community and beyond. Let me know what week works best for you and I can send over some times to connect.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

activities.subject: Introducing Our Enhanced Cross Cultural Learning Partner Program
activities.body:
Dear Sandra,​

I hope this message finds you well. At XYZ, we are always striving to innovate and provide the most impactful solutions for fostering Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion within organizations. With that commitment in mind, we are excited to introduce our updated and elevated training program: The Cross Cultural Learning Partner (CCLP).

What makes our CCLP program stand out from traditional DEI training programs? It’s designed to offer a more personalized, in-depth, and continuous learning experience. Here’s how:
Collaborative Learning: Unlike typical trainings where participants learn individually, CCLP pairs each participant with a learning partner that is culturally different in a significant way. This partnership encourages mutual support and shared growth, making the learning process richer and more effective. The cultural differences between partners offer real, lived scenarios that can be explored through open communication. Extended Engagement: While most DEI sessions are limited to just a few hours, our CCLP program spans 6 to 12 months. This extended timeframe allows for a deeper exploration of cultural competencies, continuous learning, and the opportunity to apply and reflect on insights over time. Real-World Scenarios: CCLP moves beyond hypothetical situations by integrating your unique experiences into the training. This makes the learning more relevant and directly applicable to the challenges and opportunities within your organization. Measurable Growth: Understanding your progress is key to effective learning. CCLP includes pre- and post-assessments, enabling participants to track their development and gain clear insights into how much they’ve grown after the program. We believe that our CCLP program offers a transformative approach to DEI training, and we would love to explore how it can benefit your team or organization. If you’re interested in learning more or setting up a time to discuss further, please don’t hesitate to reach out.

Looking forward to connecting!

activities.subject: Introducing Our Enhanced Cross Cultural Learning Partner Program
activities.body:
Hello Sandra,​ 

I hope you're doing well. I wanted to follow up on my previous email regarding our Cross Cultural Learning Partner (CCLP) program, as I understand things can get busy. 

To quickly recap, the CCLP program is an innovative and personalized DEI training designed to foster deeper cultural understanding and sustained growth. The Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) Assessment is a crucial tool within the CCLP program, helping participants not only identify where they are in terms of intercultural competence but also guiding them through the phases of development. Here's how it elevates the training experience: 
Understanding Key Developmental Phases: Throughout the program, participants will navigate various phases of intercultural development, progressing from a primarily monocultural perspective to a more inclusive intercultural viewpoint. This understanding is essential for fostering inclusive environments and navigating cultural differences effectively. Targeted Growth: By taking the IDI assessment at the beginning of the program, participants establish a clear baseline of where they currently stand in their intercultural development journey. We follow up with post IDI assessments as well conducted at the end of the program. This allows us to clearly measure the progress they've made, highlighting the growth in their ability to navigate and understand cultural differences more effectively over the 6-12 month program. We’d love to set up a time to discuss how the how the IDI assessment and the CCLP program can be implemented to meet your team’s needs. Please let me know what week works best, and I can send over some times to connect. 

Looking forward to your response.

activities.subject: Introducing your XYZ Senior Consultant: <PERSON>
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON> and <PERSON> –  hope you’re doing well today. We’re looking forward to rolling up our sleeves and kicking off our work together next Wednesday, July 17th at 2pm ET!

I wanted share that the Senior Consultant/Account Manager for the <LOCATION> relationship at XYZ is <PERSON><<URL>>, who is an outstanding and highly experienced consultant and a wonderful human. She has been fully briefed on our journey so far and is looking forward to meeting you. I will be there too, as will Catalina from the Translation side of the house.

<PERSON>: As you know,  <PERSON> is Director, Global Learning Leadership & Development and is based in <LOCATION>, and <PERSON> is Senior Director, Global Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Colgate Palmolive and is also based in <LOCATION>.

For our meeting next week, here are my thoughts on agenda items (<PERSON> and Catalina please feel free to add anything I may have missed!):

  *   Onboarding: how we’ll work together, clarification of roles, scheduling a regular meeting cadence, invoicing process
  *   Confirmation of deliverables
  *   Microlearnings:
     *   English version finalization
     *   Translation process & timelines – including clarifying review process and Google docs potential complications
     *   Plan with milestones, dates, and responsibilities will be provided to <LOCATION> after this meeting+
  *   Microlessons/Shift-Start Discussion Guides – timeline for these
  *   Next steps

You’re definitely in good hands with <PERSON> and Catalina leading this project and relationship.

We’ll see you next week and please reach out with any last minute questions or info that would help us be better prepared.

activities.subject: List of edits to microlearnings
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON>, here is the list of edits to the microlearnings we've already decided on:

Edits to pre-existing microlearning courses (as per <LOCATION>'s previously-outlined requests)

  *   Overall for all microlearnings: Ensure images throughout show broad diversity (gender, race, age, abilities, etc.) and ensure participants cannot skip content.
  *   Managing <PERSON> in Recruiting: Lesson 2: Ensure participants read all items in the 'Things you can say to support inclusive recruiting' thought bubbles.
  *   Managing <PERSON> in Hiring: A. Lesson 1 video: Edit out the phrase "...who in many cases will be women" from voiceover; B. Lesson 2 'Tips for interrupting and mitigating the effects of unconscious bias during the hiring process": Ensure participants read all the tips (1-7) and edit onscreen text in Tip #5 (substitute debate team example with more globally relatable example)
  *   Managing <PERSON> in Interviewing: Lesson 2: In the "What can you do?' section, under "Implicit Stereotyping Bias", substitute example in fourth bullet
  *   Managing Bias in Performance Reviews: No changes other than 'overall' edits mentioned at the top of this list.
  *   Managing Bias in Talent Review: A. Lesson 2: Replace the image of all the women with an image that is more diverse (currently photo is all women of color - we want to make sure that photo includes white women/people). B. Lesson 3: Replace <PERSON> quote with <PERSON> quote: "Being 100% sure of yourself at all times betrays arrogance and breeds complacency. Questioning yourself reflects humility and propels growth."

activities.subject: Proposal from XYZ: Building a Culture of Inclusion for AATP
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>, I’m so sorry I hadn’t followed up with cost yet. I was focusing on the demo on Tuesday and it completely escaped my mind, my apologies!

At any rate, attached is a short proposal, laying out our understanding of your need and what we propose. Please let me know if there’s anything I can clarify for you.

Our heart, soul, and purpose, since we were founded in 2000, has been to help develop the mindsets and systems needed to foster resilient, diverse, and equitable teams that will be successful in a cross-cultural world. At the heart of our expertise is approaching DEIB through a cultural competence-based lens. The foundation of our “culture first” approach is that we all belong to many different cultures- of nationality, race, generation, gender identity, abilities, religion, geographic region, educational background, socioeconomic background, and many more – at the same time. And each of those cultures are formed by particular experiences and influences in our lives, which have led us to certain core values and outward demonstrations of those values (behaviors) as being the ‘best’ and ‘most effective’. When we intentionally try to understand these experiences, influences, and values (in ourselves and others), we gain crucial insight into understanding, appreciating, navigating, and bridging behaviors that we may not initially be used to – and given those insights we can and will work much more effectively.

If what you see in this proposal is only almost right for your needs, then we look forward to hearing from you so that we can respond swiftly, make adjustments, and get you what you need to ensure alignment.

Again, we’re extremely interested in developing a relationship with BNP Paribas, and in becoming one of your trusted DEIB and intercultural training and consulting advisors and partners.

Looking forward to Tuesday!
<PERSON><PERSON><

activities.subject: RE: Thank you
activities.body:
Thanks, <PERSON>.  I can make the 14th work.  Is there any way we could do the 15th by chance?

Here’s a summary of our full (non customized) workshop. Of course I’m not going to be able to cover all the content, but at least it will give folks some context around what I’ll be presenting about:

“Building a Culture of Inclusion in a Global Organization”
In this workshop, participants reflect on culture, identity, and blind spots that often affect our ability to successfully build an inclusive culture. The program starts off with a reminder of how and why intercultural competence and inclusion are building blocks for high performance and innovation. Participants explore the powerful role that culture plays in shaping and driving behavior and expectations in the workplace. A model for identifying and navigating cultural differences will be introduced, as well as with frameworks for identifying, understanding, and seeing the value of differences in their teams. The program also covers recognizing and countering microinequities while validating their colleagues’ backgrounds and experiences. Case studies, activities, and other interactions are leveraged to help participants apply learning and build skills to successfully identify and optimize differences. By the end of the workshop, participants will have tools to model behaviors that create an inclusive culture to develop deeper relationships and promote greater productivity, collaboration, and breakthrough thinking at BNP Paribas.

activities.subject: RE: Thank you
activities.body:
Good morning <PERSON>,
Thank you for meeting with us yesterday. Some dates that might work for us for a demo would be 4:30pm on Monday May 13th or Tuesday May 14th. We tend to have better attendance from analysts in the late afternoon after the market closes.

Would you be able to provide us with a brief summary of the training that we could send out in the calendar invitation for those coming to the session? Would you also be able to provide us with a cost estimate for the July engagement we discussed yesterday?

activities.subject: [EXTERNAL] Thank you
activities.body:
<PERSON> and <PERSON>,
Thank you so much for reaching out to us and taking the time to chat today, truly.

We’d very much look forward to partnering with you to deliver an effective, interactive, and engaging workshop for new analysts and associates that:

  *   Emphasizes BNP Paribas’ values and approach to inclusion – as well as the ‘why’
  *   Outlines how culture impacts behavior and shapes our ability to describe and assess it
  *   Identifies how cultural differences play out in the workplace
  *   Shows them how to leverage differences for maximum team collaboration, effectiveness, and performance
  *   Provides examples of unconscious bias and microinequities in the workplace, and identifies ways to counter them while validating colleagues’  backgrounds and experiences
  *   Sends a strong message that each and every one of them feels and knows that they belong at the bank.
  *   Provides them with memorable knowledge and tools they can use not just as they start at BNPP, but throughout their entire career.
  *   Is aligned with BNP Paribas culture, bank culture, and also fits well within the context of the full summer induction program

We look forward to scheduling the demo and meeting your other colleagues. And please do thank <PERSON> on our behalf for recommending us!

activities.subject: RE: XYZ & BNP Paribas Inquiry
activities.body:
You don't often get email from <EMAIL_ADDRESS><mailto:<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>. Learn why this is important<<URL>>
Hi <PERSON>,
Great to meet you! I’d love to chat more about our summer AATP Induction. I’m happy to meet with you tomorrow or Friday. If not I can make your Tuesday at 11:30am or 12pm timeslot. A bit more about the what we are looking for:

Every summer BNP Paribas welcomes over a hundred full time staff members as a part of the Analyst and Associate Training Program (AATP) for a week long training and orientation. These individuals are junior staff who have just graduated from their undergraduate or Master’s program and this is likely their first job. This year, we would like to include interactive DEIB conversations into their summer induction program and I wanted to inquire about what that could look like and the cost involved. I’d like to center the conversation around cultural humility and awareness of social identity. This is important as BNP Paribas is a global bank and it is common practice to interact across countries/cultures on a daily basis. We want to emphasize and encourage them to keep a sense of openness as they enter the bank and give them the awareness of the social identities they bring to the workplace every day in order to better work with their colleagues.  Building their awareness of unconscious biases and helping to shape attitudes that make BNPP a place where people feel comfortable sharing their voice.

Some additional relevant information:
# of participants: 80-85 per session (total around 165), we would be splitting the group in half for the day, so they would either have this in the morning or in the afternoon. Majority of participants would be from the <LOCATION>, but we would also have some flying in from <LOCATION>, LatAM, and <LOCATION>.
Date: Tuesday, July 23rd 2024
Time: First session 9am-12pm and the second session would be 1:30pm-4:30pm participants would either be assigned to the first or second session.
Location: NYC Convene location at 117 West 46th Street

Happy to answer any questions you have. I look forward to chatting.

Thanks again.
<PERSON>

Thank you for reaching out about our services and possible ways we can collaborate. My name is <PERSON>, I’m a business development associate here at XYZ.

I’d love to set up a time for us to connect.

I understand you are looking to curate a diversity training for 170 entry level analysts. Could you please share with me a bit more about what you have in mind? It would be incredibly helpful as we prepare for our meeting.

Here are some times we have available for a 45 minute meeting next week:


  *   Tuesday, April 30th at 11am or 12pm EST
  *   Wednesday, May 1st at 2pm or 3pm EST
  *   Thursday, May 2nd at 10am, 11am, 1pm or 2pm EST

Let me know if any of these times work for you and I’ll send invites accordingly. Looking forward to connecting!

activities.subject: RE: Good morning! Follow-up from XYZ
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>. Thank you.

Obviously this is extremely disappointing - especially since these were just pieces of an overall course and were taken out of context and a lot was missing.  I'm also sure that the demo being at the end of the day didn't exactly help either!

Transparently, it's very rare that we get negative reviews like this, and because these folks were from a particular generational demographic, any additional detail you can provide would greatly help us improve.  For example:

  1.  How did we "miss the mark", specifically?
  2.  In what way/s did we "have a disconnect with the audience"?
  3.  What exactly do you, <PERSON> and <PERSON>, or the participants view as 'new' or 'a more serious and objective presentation, showing new information'?

If a short call would be better, I'm totally game for it. Even 15 minutes would be super helpful!

Thanks so much in advance,
<PERSON><PERSON><

activities.subject: RE: Good morning! Follow-up from XYZ
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,
Thank you so much for the demo last week! Below is some of the feedback we received:

We received positive feedback related to:

  *   The trainer provided real life examples.
  *   The trainer put the content in context that made it easy for me (or an AATP) to understand.

Overall we received very mixed or negative reviews on the scores related to:

  *   I feel confident that I could apply at least one thing I learned today in my role.
  *   Did you find the course engaging?
  *   Did you find the instructor engaging?
  *   The training tools and resources (format, handouts, poll everywhere platform, etc.) supported participation in the session.
  *   How likely are you to recommend this course to a friend, colleague, or AATP?

Some of the open ended feedback included:

  *   "Very nice facilitator, however among other trainings this information seemed extremely redundant. Not sure if I learned anything NEW. Definitely a relevant subject for today's day and age, but for the highly qualified individuals BNP employs, I'm afraid the information provided is likely not new/helping employees truly GROW."
  *   "The course actually does a good job of thinking about DEI&B critically, and I think would be very conducive to in-person learning"
  *   "I think this just missed the mark, but the idea behind it seemed almost there, the instructor seemed to have a disconnect with the audience."
  *   "In my opinion, this course will have a hard time engaging AATPs given the pace of the class, the amount of participation required for "basic" things. I would recommend a more serious and objective presentation, showing new information. Especially given that a lot of the material presented is already talked about in college. The bottom line is that I don't think you will get the type of engagement, interest and focus as one would expect from the AATPs."

I understand the training is meant to be in-person vs the demo we held virtually, but I don't think the training is exactly what we had in mind for this summer induction training. The price you quoted for the one day engagement is also a bit out of the budget of our Early Careers team. We would love to keep you in mind for future opportunities though.

activities.subject: [EXTERNAL] Good morning! Follow-up from XYZ
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>, how are you? Wondering if there was any feedback/notes for us from last week's demo/pilot? And of course, please let me know if y'all need clarification on anything! We'd really also appreciate any feedback of where you feel we've missed your desired mark, so we have the chance to course correct. I'm sure we can exceed your expectations!
Best - Rebecca

<PERSON><

activities.subject: RE: XYZ & BNP Paribas Inquiry
activities.body:
You don't often get email from <EMAIL_ADDRESS><mailto:<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>. Learn why this is important<<URL>>
Hi <PERSON>,
Great to meet you! I'd love to chat more about our summer AATP Induction. I'm happy to meet with you tomorrow or Friday. If not I can make your Tuesday at 11:30am or 12pm timeslot. A bit more about the what we are looking for:

Every summer BNP Paribas welcomes over a hundred full time staff members as a part of the Analyst and Associate Training Program (AATP) for a week long training and orientation. These individuals are junior staff who have just graduated from their undergraduate or Master's program and this is likely their first job. This year, we would like to include interactive DEIB conversations into their summer induction program and I wanted to inquire about what that could look like and the cost involved. I'd like to center the conversation around cultural humility and awareness of social identity. This is important as BNP Paribas is a global bank and it is common practice to interact across countries/cultures on a daily basis. We want to emphasize and encourage them to keep a sense of openness as they enter the bank and give them the awareness of the social identities they bring to the workplace every day in order to better work with their colleagues.  Building their awareness of unconscious biases and helping to shape attitudes that make BNPP a place where people feel comfortable sharing their voice.

Some additional relevant information:
# of participants: 80-85 per session (total around 165), we would be splitting the group in half for the day, so they would either have this in the morning or in the afternoon. Majority of participants would be from the <LOCATION>, but we would also have some flying in from <LOCATION>, LatAM, and <LOCATION>.
Date: Tuesday, July 23rd 2024
Time: First session 9am-12pm and the second session would be 1:30pm-4:30pm participants would either be assigned to the first or second session.
Location: NYC Convene location at 117 West 46th Street

Happy to answer any questions you have. I look forward to chatting.

activities.note_body: 4/30/24 CALL NOTESBNP Part: <PERSON>, L&D Manager, Early CareersCherry McCutchen, VP-Americas Learning and Development ManagerXYZ Part: <PERSON>, <PERSON>, <PERSON>-call <PERSON> (requests from emails, other knowledge)A bit more about the what we are looking for:Every summer BNP Paribas welcomes over a hundred full time staff members as a part of the Analyst and Associate Training Program (AATP) for a weeklong training and orientation (summer induction program). These individuals are junior staff who have just graduated from their undergraduate or Master’s program and this is likely their first job. This year we'd like to include interactive DEIB conversations into the program and I wanted to inquire about what that could look like and the cost involved. I’d like to center the conversation around cultural humility and awareness of social identity. This is important as BNP Paribas is a global bank and it is common practice to interact across countries/cultures on a daily basis. We want to emphasize and encourage them to keep a sense of openness as they enter the bank and give them the awareness of the social identities they bring to the workplace every day in order to better work with their colleagues. Building their awareness of unconscious biases and helping to shape attitudes that make BNP a place where people feel comfortable sharing their voice.# of participants: 80-85 per session (total around 165), we would be splitting the group in half for the day, so they would either have this in the morning or in the <URL>jority of participants would be from the <LOCATION>, but we would also have some flying in from <LOCATION>, LatAM, and <URL>: Tuesday, July 23rd 2024Time: First session 9am-12pm and the second session would be 1:30pm-4:30pm participants would either be assigned to the first or second session.Location: NYC Convene location at 117 West 46th StreetRP pre-call notes:BCI in a Global Org"Tailored for first time/younger employees, add cultural self-awareness activities (cultural identities exercises from C&I eLearning), add more time to ‘MCDMB’ fill-in-the-blanks activity, add more time to all discussions including case studies, invite them to tailor quotes from ‘intercultural competence means…” and microinequities examples.2-fac full day = $25kNOTES:In the past the program has been 3 weeks. The first week, everyone is together. After that, addl readiness training where they separate into their own tracks. Day 1 is BNP Values day. Day 2 would be us. The group that's not doing our session will be doing a workshop called Climate Fresk – which discussed things like climate change, sustainability. 3-hour workshopWho recommended us to you?  <PERSON>, Managing Director, Head of Learning & Development.We want it to have a high level of engagement and interaction, DEIB, weaving in sustainability throughout. Should be super engaging and interactive. New employees walk away with, we belong here, and this is <URL>ep in mind that these folks are fresh out of college, and likely have already had experience with <URL> can they apply what they learn in our <NRP> incorporate 'bank culture'.What's the high level outcome you want out of this workshop?They walk away feeling like they made the right choice ‘bc I’m having this workshop on day 2 of being in this new job’ - this exemplifies the importance of this topic. They have a sense of belonging.We value everyone. As they work across borders, sensitive to timezones, diversity – we’re all in this together and we all belong here. BNP is a place where I’m welcome, where I belong, and can <URL>n we audit a session? OR a taste of training? A short engagement with BNP stakeholders.  A short pilot, some HR folks will attend too. One hour. Budget – no number that is set.We recommend 2 cross cultural facilitators. We request that facilitators can relate to this population, meaning a language and approach for this particular generation. Not necessarily young facilitators, just that they are savvy about this stuff.What other questions do you have?Next steps:Send pricing. Mention that we did something like this for BCG.  Our content drives behavioral <URL>nd them sample case studiesCasey will send us times to schedule the demo for prob the week after next – after looking at schedules.

Call Notes 4/30/24Attendees: Casey Dowling & Cherry McCutchenXYZ Attendees: RP, Alisa & PedroCasey- working with new employees and internCherry- <LOCATION> HUB manager for learning and development Common 1st week training. XYZ training opportunityTraining to be delivered on the new person's second day orientation. BNP values daySplit into two groupsReferral- from Colleague within BNP.  (Ruby Francis?)RP gave overview of XYZ services and years in the spaceThey want something with interactions and engagement, as well as BNP's DEIB view. The main focus for them is to get these new employees feeling like "I made the right choice". They feeling that they are welcomed and others as well.What's the main takeaways after the session? <PERSON> mentioned, sense of belonging, sense of purpose. Main goal "I'm having this type of training on day number 2, so great things ahead."Next steps a demo or pilot for internal stakeholders. (<PERSON> to set up next meeting. Preliminary step: figuring out pricing as well as next steps. Looking for an hour, hour and a half demo. Budget? Not at the moment. Terminology you want used? (banking folks)RP spoke about 2 facilitators delivering our sessions, the importance of having two perspectives.Facilitators must be able to relate to the participants.

Hi,

Just tried to call.  Couple of questions:


  *   Overall DEI training for the organization has come up as a priority and I wanted to know our options; we are under a time crunch to submit it as a budget request
  *   Are there any demos of the neurodiversity training that can be shared?

Thank you!

<PERSON>
