activities.subject: RE: EXTERNAL: RE: XYZ Neurodiverse Training
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,
Thanks for the update!
Yes, we can absolutely split the payments.
The timeline was a ballpark and may vary (e.g. extended by 2-4 weeks) depending on our bandwidth  at the time of contracting.
Please let us know if there’s anything else we can clarify for you.
We appreciate y’all!

activities.subject: RE: EXTERNAL: RE: XYZ Neurodiverse Training
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

Thank you so much for your detailed email; this is extremely helpful!  The content/series is robust and what I imagined.  With that cost, this would have to be included in our FY25 planning which begins this summer with FY25 officially beginning October 1.  We don’t have the budget to take action immediately in FY24.

Now that I have the content and cost, I need to discuss this with my director in my next 1x1. Give me a couple of weeks and I will circle back with you.  At that point, it will probably also make sense to set up a meeting to discuss in more detail and to answer any questions I have.

One question – The last time we partnered with XYZ we paid in full, but is there the opportunity to split up the payments?

Thank you again and we will talk soon.

<PERSON>

activities.subject: RE: EXTERNAL: RE: XYZ Neurodiverse Training
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON>,
Thank you for your extreme patience with our reply.

We could build a microlearning, similar in design as the ones you already have, which upskills managers on developing, coaching, and helping their neurodivergent team members feel like their contributions matter and that they belong in the team and at the company.

An example outline of what such a microlearning or microlearning series would include:


  1.  Introduction to Neurodiversity
     *   Discuss the importance of creating an inclusive culture at Rockwell.
     *   Define neurodiversity and its importance in the workplace: <NRP> people think, process information, and learn differently as compared to those who are neurotypical.
     *   Explain the various forms of neurodivergence: Examples of neurodivergence include the autism spectrum, ADHD, traumatic brain injury, Down syndrome, Tourette syndrome, dyslexia, <PERSON>, dysgraphia, sensory processing disorders, or other intellectual disabilities. “Neurodiversity” describes the entire spectrum of ways in which human beings think, process information, and learn. All neurological variations should be respected and celebrated, and are part of the normal range of human diversity.
     *   Discuss common myths and misconceptions.
  2.  Understanding Neurodivergent Perspectives
     *   Explore how neurodivergent individuals may experience the workplace differently.
     *   Provide insights into how neurodivergent individuals tend to think, process information, and learn.
     *   Share personal stories or snippets from neurodivergent individuals at Rockwell (if available) or others.
  3.  Communication and Feedback
     *   Provide guidance on effective communication strategies when working with neurodivergent team members.
     *   Emphasize the importance of clear and direct communication.
     *   Offer tips for providing constructive feedback tailored to individual needs and preferences.
  4.  Developing and Coaching Neurodivergent Team Members
     *   Discuss strategies for recognizing and leveraging the strengths of neurodivergent team members.
     *   Provide guidance on setting realistic goals and expectations.
     *   Offer coaching techniques that accommodate different learning styles and preferences.
  5.  Navigating Challenges
     *   Address common challenges that may arise when working with neurodivergent team members.
     *   Provide strategies for addressing misunderstandings and potential sources of tension
     *   Emphasize the importance of self-awareness, intercultural competence, curiosity, and flexibility in resolving issues.
     *   Discuss how to work collaboratively with neurodivergent team members to identify needs and provide support.
  6.  Promoting Belonging and Recognition
     *   Discuss the importance of ensuring that neurodivergent team members feel valued, included, and appreciated.
     *   Provide tips for promoting a sense of belonging and recognition within the team and the company.
     *   Highlight the role of managers in advocating for the needs and contributions of neurodivergent team members.
  7.  Resources and Further Support
     *   Provide information on additional resources, support networks, and organizations focused on neurodiversity.
     *   Offer guidance on where to find additional training at Rockwell, related to supporting neurodivergent individuals (eg., HR pertaining to reasonable accommodations, other DEI training/resources, ERG).

The course will have elements of interactivity, videos, an action planning element, and a downloadable pdf with key takeaways.

The cost for the build would be $35k. It includes a perpetual, unlimited site license.

A general ballpark timeline would be 8 weeks. I can get back to you with a more precise timeline if you’d like me to.

Warmly,
<PERSON><PERSON><

activities.subject: REGISTER FOR FREE PREVIEW: Spotlights on the <NRP> & Jewish Communities in the <LOCATION>
activities.body:
Hi Yvonne,​

As part of our ongoing commitment to fostering cultural understanding and promoting inclusion, we’re excited to announce an upcoming no-cost session previewing our two new programs: "Spotlight on the Jewish Community in the <LOCATION>" and "Spotlight on the Muslim Community in the <LOCATION>." The preview will take place on May 29th, 2024 from 2-3pm ET / 1-2pm CT. 

These two additions to our Spotlights library were carefully designed and vetted by interculturalists and culture-expert members of the <NRP> and <NRP> community. Facilitated by two cross-cultural expert facilitators (one a member of the community and one ally), the Spotlights provide participants with valuable insights into the histories, values, experiences, and influences that shape each of these distinct cultures, and deliver an insightful and nuanced understanding of the <NRP> and <NRP> experiences in <LOCATION> - dispelling misconceptions and fostering empathy. These sessions do not explain or resolve current geopolitical events, do not advocate particular points of view or debate history, and like all of our Spotlights, aim to build cultural competence and understanding. 

The Spotlights helps participants: 
Explore factors that have shaped the lived experiences and cultural values of the community in the <LOCATION>, including shared experiences and common influences. Recognize the depth and diversity of the community in the <LOCATION> Discuss historical and contemporary prejudice against the community. Explore strategies to support and be an ally to your colleagues and the community at large. In our preview we’ll demonstrate sample content from both Spotlights, show you the agenda for each, and answer your questions. 

REGISTER FOR THE SPOTLIGHTS PREVIEW:
Wednesday, May 29th, 2024 from 2-3pm ET / 1-2pm CT Register Here: <URL> 

We believe that these Spotlights can be valuable tools which, in conjunction with other elements of your DEI infrastructure, work towards de-polarization and enhancing participants’ ability to engage meaningfully with individuals from these backgrounds. 

We're looking forward to seeing you there!

activities.subject: Short, high-impact sessions on the <NRP> and the Jewish Experiences in the <LOCATION>
activities.body:
Hi Yvonne,​

We’re thrilled to shared that we’re launching two brand new Spotlight sessions aimed at highlighting the experiences, influences, values and rich cultures of the <NRP> and <NRP> communities in the <LOCATION>

Our Spotlights are one-hour, interactive, deep-dive workshops are focused on the experience of being a member of these communities, and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills, and a culture of belonging throughout your organization. 

☪️Spotlight on the Muslim Community (1-hr)
This session explores the complexities of being <NRP> in <LOCATION> and the simultaneously varied and shared experiences and worldviews of <LOCATION>’s <NRP> community. In this session, we unpack the concepts of culture versus religion and discuss current issues and events impacting the <NRP> experience and perspectives. Best practices for allyship and countering bias in the workplace will be shared. Session objectives:
Explore factors that have shaped the lived experiences and cultural values of the <NRP> community, including shared experiences and common influences Recognize the depth and diversity of the <NRP> community in the <LOCATION> Discuss <NRP> sentiment (especially since 9/11) and its impact on the <NRP> community Explore strategies to support and be an ally to your <NRP> colleagues and the community at large 
🔯Spotlight on the Jewish Community (1-hr)
This session introduces participants to key historical and social/cultural events that shape this community, as well as the cultural values and practices that influence the <NRP> experience. The session will also unpack stereotypes, debunk myths, and address antisemitism and its impact in the workplace today. We share best practices for supporting and providing allyship to our colleagues with the community, and how to counter antisemitic bias and microaggressions. Session objectives:
Explore factors that have shaped the lived experiences and cultural values of the <NRP> community, including shared experiences and common influences. Recognize the depth and diversity of the <NRP> community in the <LOCATION> Discuss the current state of Antisemitism and its impact on the <NRP> community. Explore strategies to support and be an ally to your <NRP> colleagues and the community at large. Below are one-pagers for each session, that you may share with your stakeholders. 

Other Spotlights that you may consider for 2024:
Being an Ally for the Asian American Community (May, AAPI Heritage Month) Spotlight on the LGBTQ+ Community (June, LGBTQ+ Pride Month) Spotlight on Persons with Disabilities (July, Disability Pride Month) Spotlight on U.S. Generations (April, August, December, anytime) Spotlight on the <NRP>/Latinx/e Community (September, Hispanic Heritage Month 9/15-10/15) Spotlight on Indigenous People in <LOCATION> (October, Indigenous Peoples’ Day or November, Native American Heritage Month) Spotlight on the U.S. Veterans Community (November, Veterans’ Day) If you have any questions and would like to connect, please let me what days work best and I’ll send over some times.

activities.subject: Commemorating Juneteenth & Its Legacy
activities.body:
Dear Yvonne,​

Many employers are planning to recognize <LOCATION> this year to celebrate this significant date in <NRP> history. 

<LOCATION>, a federal holiday celebrated annually on June 19th, marks the completion of emancipation of enslaved <NRP> in <LOCATION>, and symbolizes freedom, resilience, and the ongoing struggle for equality.

We believe that it's crucial to take the opportunity to reflect, learn, and engage in meaningful conversations about <LOCATION> and its importance to our employees and clients. To help you facilitate this dialogue, we have developed a one-hour session on this topic.

Our virtual workshop, Understanding <LOCATION> and Its Legacy, has the following objectives:
Explore <LOCATION>’s historical context, its significance in <NRP> history, and how it has evolved over time. Understand how many organizations have historically exploited the holiday. Explore ways in which individuals and organizations can commit to supporting and advocating for <NRP> communities beyond designated months or holidays. We also invite you to sample our “Commemorating Juneteenth” microlearning via this link: <URL> It will remain open and available for you until May 31st. Just enter your email address and name, and you’ll get access.

Understanding the roots of this holiday and its lasting impact is an important element for fostering empathy, awareness, and inclusion. Bringing colleagues together to engage in this opportunity to learn about history and progress has a positive impact in the workplace.

If you’re interested or have any questions, please reply to this email and we can set up a meeting.

activities.subject: Get Ready for Hispanic Heritage Month with XYZ's Spotlight Bundle Offer!
activities.body:
Hi Yvonne,​ 

I hope all is well! As you are planning out end of summer initiatives, as well as, strategizing for the next quarter and year, I wanted to share some of the ways we support our clients when it comes to culture focused education initiatives. Below I’ve listed an overview of the type of rollout we see when clients purchase our various Community Spotlight Bundles. Our rollouts are flexible based on your budget. I would like to schedule time with you to learn more about how we can best partner and answer any questions, I’m happy to help! 

Overview of our Spotlight Series: 
The Muslim Community – suggested delivery date, January (Muslim Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) Black/African Community – suggested delivery date, February (Black History month) (1 Facilitator) Women in Leadership – suggested delivery date, March (Women’s History Month) (1 Facilitator) The Jewish Community – suggested delivery date, May (Jewish Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) Being an Ally for the Asian American Community – Suggested delivery date, May (AAPI Heritage month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) The LGBTQ+ Community – suggested delivery date, June (Pride Month) (1 Facilitator) Persons with Disabilities – suggested delivery date, July (Disability Pride Month) (1 Facilitator) The Hispanic Community – suggested delivery date, September (Hispanic Heritage Month) (1 Facilitator) Indigenous People in <LOCATION> – suggested delivery date, October (Indigenous Peoples’ Day) or November (Native American Heritage Month) (2 facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) U.S. Veterans Community – suggested delivery date, November (Veterans’ Day) (1 Facilitator) U.S Generations – suggested delivery date, December, April or August (1 Facilitator) Special bundle pricing available for full rollouts. We’d love to connect to share additional resources with you. Let me know what week works best for you and I’ll send over some times. 

Have a great week!

You can review a sample here:  <URL><<URL>>

You'll be able to access the first three of six lessons.

The complete course includes:


  *   Introduction: Gain a solid overview of DEI principles, and why it’s important.

activities.subject: Exclusive Invitation to Participate in XYZ's climate Interview
activities.body:
Dear Bobby,​

Over the past 24 years of working with organizations like yours, we have learned the impact internal and external climates have on our clients doing the work to support inclusion within their organizations. These past few years have truly been filled with change, directional shifts, and future uncertainty. We understand the importance of being a true partner and are excited to announce our exclusive initiative to support our stakeholders by conducting a comprehensive climate interview and survey. The goal of the survey will be to assess how the mindsets and systems within organizations have influenced organizational climate over the past few years and impacted inclusive workplaces. The information we collect from the interview and survey will be treated with utmost confidentiality and the key takeaways will be shared with all selected participants. Based on the key takeaways, we will be sharing relevant resources, developing new content, providing action steps, and offering opportunities to learn and collaborate with peers. 

Please select the time that works best for a 30-minute interview: <URL>

Thank you for considering this opportunity. We look forward to your participation and serving as a continued resource to you and your organization.

activities.subject: Introducing Our Enhanced Cross Cultural Learning Partner Program
activities.body:
Hello Yvonne,​ 

I hope you're doing well. I wanted to follow up on my previous email regarding our Cross Cultural Learning Partner (CCLP) program, as I understand things can get busy. 

To quickly recap, the CCLP program is an innovative and personalized DEI training designed to foster deeper cultural understanding and sustained growth. The Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) Assessment is a crucial tool within the CCLP program, helping participants not only identify where they are in terms of intercultural competence but also guiding them through the phases of development. Here's how it elevates the training experience: 
Understanding Key Developmental Phases: Throughout the program, participants will navigate various phases of intercultural development, progressing from a primarily monocultural perspective to a more inclusive intercultural viewpoint. This understanding is essential for fostering inclusive environments and navigating cultural differences effectively. Targeted Growth: By taking the IDI assessment at the beginning of the program, participants establish a clear baseline of where they currently stand in their intercultural development journey. We follow up with post IDI assessments as well conducted at the end of the program. This allows us to clearly measure the progress they've made, highlighting the growth in their ability to navigate and understand cultural differences more effectively over the 6-12 month program. We’d love to set up a time to discuss how the how the IDI assessment and the CCLP program can be implemented to meet your team’s needs. Please let me know what week works best, and I can send over some times to connect. 

Looking forward to your response.

activities.subject: Get Ready for Hispanic Heritage Month with XYZ's Spotlight Bundle Offer!
activities.body:
Dear Yvonne,​

As Hispanic Heritage Month approaches, now is the perfect time to celebrate and deepen your organization's understanding of the <NRP> community's rich history, culture, and contributions. At XYZ, we are excited to offer our Spotlight on the Hispanic Community, designed to educate and engage your teams in meaningful conversations during this important time. This Spotlight session is available both in English and Spanish.

Our Spotlights are one-hour, interactive, deep-dive workshops that focus on the experience of being a member of these communities, and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills and a culture of belonging throughout the firm.

In addition, we are running a special offer on our Spotlight Bundle, which includes a total of 11 Spotlight sessions. As your teams plan for their 2025 initiatives, our Spotlight Bundle offers an excellent opportunity to ensure a focused and consistent effort to highlight and educate employees about various communities that make up their peers. Whether you're looking to enhance your DEI initiatives or simply want to keep the conversation going, we feel this bundle is a valuable resource for your organization.

Here’s are the names of the other 10 Spotlight sessions: The Jewish Community, The Muslim Community, Black/African Community, Women in Leadership, Being an Ally for the Asian American Community, The LGBTQ+ Community, Persons with Disabilities, Indigenous People in <LOCATION>, U.S. Veterans Community, and U.S Generations.

I’d love to schedule some time to discuss how our Spotlights can align with your goals and enrich your team's understanding of the <NRP> community and beyond. Let me know what week works best for you and I can send over some times to connect.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

activities.subject: Introducing Our Enhanced Cross Cultural Learning Partner Program
activities.body:
Dear Yvonne,​

I hope this message finds you well. At XYZ, we are always striving to innovate and provide the most impactful solutions for fostering Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion within organizations. With that commitment in mind, we are excited to introduce our updated and elevated training program: The Cross Cultural Learning Partner (CCLP).

What makes our CCLP program stand out from traditional DEI training programs? It’s designed to offer a more personalized, in-depth, and continuous learning experience. Here’s how:
Collaborative Learning: Unlike typical trainings where participants learn individually, CCLP pairs each participant with a learning partner that is culturally different in a significant way. This partnership encourages mutual support and shared growth, making the learning process richer and more effective. The cultural differences between partners offer real, lived scenarios that can be explored through open communication. Extended Engagement: While most DEI sessions are limited to just a few hours, our CCLP program spans 6 to 12 months. This extended timeframe allows for a deeper exploration of cultural competencies, continuous learning, and the opportunity to apply and reflect on insights over time. Real-World Scenarios: CCLP moves beyond hypothetical situations by integrating your unique experiences into the training. This makes the learning more relevant and directly applicable to the challenges and opportunities within your organization. Measurable Growth: Understanding your progress is key to effective learning. CCLP includes pre- and post-assessments, enabling participants to track their development and gain clear insights into how much they’ve grown after the program. We believe that our CCLP program offers a transformative approach to DEI training, and we would love to explore how it can benefit your team or organization. If you’re interested in learning more or setting up a time to discuss further, please don’t hesitate to reach out.

Looking forward to connecting!

activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

Hope you’re having a great week! I wanted to take this opportunity to provide you with our price points for some of our services.

Below you’ll see an overview of our pricing for our Facilitated Sessions (Spotlights), Micro-Learnings, as well as our E-Learnings.

During our call you mentioned the importance of a session that could start the journey and help set the tone. I’ve included an overview & pricing for our facilitated session called Foundations of Diversity & Inclusion.


  *   This session introduces the concepts of diversity, inclusion, and culture. Meant for audiences who are closer to the beginning of their organization’s inclusion journey, this session differentiates between diversity and inclusion, touches on the powerful role that culture plays in driving behavior and expectations in the workplace, and offers examples of day-to-day actions which, although usually unintentional, contribute towards a sense of disengagement or lack of belonging. Examples of inclusive everyday behaviors are also provided, and an opportunity to brainstorm what you would do to practice inclusion through short scenarios. (1 Facilitator) (1 Hour Session) - $3,000 virtual facilitation.

When it comes to our facilitated sessions, we also have what’s called our Spotlight Series. These one-hour, interactive, deep-dive workshops that are focused on the experience of being a member of these communities, and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills, and a culture of belonging throughout the organization. Here is some pricing info on our two latest Spotlights.

Facilitated Sessions (Discount available for Spotlight Bundle, 11 Spotlights total)

  1.  Spotlight on the Jewish Community (2 facilitators, 1 cultural insider & 1 ally) (1.5-hour session)- $4,500
  2.  Spotlight on the Muslim Community (2 facilitators, 1 cultural insider & 1 ally) (1.5-hour session) - $4,500

We also understand you’re interested in training around recruiting and how to be an effective leader. In my previous email I provided a link for our Micro Learning on Managing Bias in Performance Reviews. I think it ties in nicely with the topics you are interested in. We wanted to share prices with you on our digital learning solutions, that’s both our Micro Learnings and E-Learnings. I understand you are interested in facilitated sessions, just want to make sure you know the different training and pricing options XYZ has.

Micro Learnings (5-minute session to help enforce the right behaviors)

E- Learnings (20-minute session, self-paced, can enter and exit course at any time and pick up where they left off)

We would love to reconnect and walk you through any questions you might have. Let me know what dates work best for you and I’ll send out some times to connect!

Wants to do sessions quarterly and do them with leadership.-Has done workshops with <LOCATION>; unconscious bias and psychological safety and how to share feedback did it last year.-Have some team members that are very new to DEI and need fundamental.-78% of clients are Bipoc and minority owned and have programs to support diverse communities that may not be able to afford their services.-Hired a lot of new folks in the past year.**Initial training to start**-Wants to ensure there is more representation with the firm.-Work life balance and culture is very important to Dreamday.**Wants little nuggets to employees to help them have language that is more inclusive.**Wants perspectives from different communities.**Wants to start company wide.**Wants to do a training in Sept/October****Wants heritage month trainings****Wants training vs e-learning**-Needs the founder bought in and wants one session.-Wants this to be part of the culture and <URL> budget: $2,000 <URL>emes: Wants to incorporate feedback and 1. DE&I (wants more of a beginner one) and then 2. feedback and then 3. Leadership training recruiting, management and different team members.**PR has a bad reputation of all white women.**Wants to vet clients and brands, they choose to represent.**Having the proposal 29th, schedule meeting after labor day, and then rollout in October.

activities.subject: Thank You for Attending the DEIB Conference - Let's Continue the Conversation!
activities.body:
CAUTION: This email originated from outside of Commerce Bank. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
Dear Felecia,​

It was great to attend the 6th annual DEIB Conference in <LOCATION> on July 23rd with you. We found it to be an inspiring and impactful event and hope you did too! XYZ’s, <PERSON> had the privilege of moderating the panel, "The Future of DEI Amidst a Changing Landscape" - we hope you found the discussion thought-provoking. Due to time constraints, there were many unanswered questions submitted in the Whova app, so we wanted to follow-up with you.

XYZ has been committed to intercultural competence and inclusion in the workplace since 2000 – going through the ups and downs (but mostly ups!) with our clients, whether it’s through strategic consulting, training, or creative, collaborative projects and brainstorming with L&D, DEI, and business leaders. May we set up a 30 minute chat to provide our responses to some of the questions asked and listen to the biggest problems you’re trying to solve in your current environment? If it turns out there’s an opportunity to partner on a project - big or small, now or later - then great. And if not, that’s okay too – it would still be great to connect with you, provide some valuable resources and learn from you.

Please let us know which week you would like to meet, and we can send you our availability.

Thank you once again for taking the time to read this, and we look forward to meeting with you!
RP emailed on Jan.22

I hope this message finds you well.

I wanted to follow up on my previous email regarding the Diversity Woman Media DEIB conference in <LOCATION> on July 23rd. It was a pleasure seeing such enthusiastic participation and engagement during the event. Since attending, we have been compiling various resources to offer all of the attendees and would like to share them with you.

Here at XYZ, we are eager to continue the conversation and explore how we can support your DEI initiatives.

What does your schedule permit in the next few weeks to connect? I would love to schedule a brief follow-up conversation to discuss your specific needs, share timely resources, and discuss how XYZ can assist you in supporting those goals. Let me know what works best, and we’ll be sure to accommodate.

Thank you for your time and consideration. We look forward to the opportunity to work together.

Call notes 9/4/24Attendees: Lacy & FeleciaXYZ Attendees: <PERSON>, RP & PedroQuick round of introductionsLacy- From <LOCATION>. Senior DEI program manager at the org. 5 and a half years at the company. She loves the companies commitment to the community and the feedback they get. In this specific role for the last 2 years. Focus on community, supplier diversity effortsRP asked what would you like the call to be centered around?Felicia mentioned they are leveraging <PERSON>. (for learning) (they produce video content) Contract expires in January. Opportunity to enhance their learning. activities.subject: Re: Elevate Engagement and Collaboration in 2025 with XYZ’s <LOCATION>!
activities.body:
Thank you, <PERSON>! This a great comprehensive list of topics.

Are these exclusively for live virtual events, or would there be an option to record and share on our intranet site? We’ve received feedback that live events are more difficult to attend for many leaders, but they often access recordings from our resource pages internally.

activities.subject: Elevate Engagement and Collaboration in 2025 with XYZ’s <LOCATION>!
activities.body:
Hi Tyler,​

As you look ahead to 2025, we’re excited to introduce XYZ’s lineup of <LOCATION>—a series of 75-minute dynamic, interactive virtual trainings designed to foster engagement, support effective collaboration, and enhance intercultural competence across your organization. These sessions delve into key areas such as inclusive leadership, building cultural competence, collaborating across generations, and neurodiversity inclusion in the workplace. Each of these sessions provides practical strategies for teams to work more cohesively in today’s diverse environments.

Whether your goal is to drive engagement, inclusion, or cultural literacy, our <LOCATION> are a flexible resource that can be tailored to fit your organization’s unique goals.

Take a look at our Miniworkshop Sessions Overview: <URL> where you'll see the breadth of topics we cover (we can custom-build one for you too!).

We’d love to discuss how these sessions could align with your 2025 learning goals.

Looking forward to connecting!

activities.subject: Re: Follow Up: XYZ Course Catalog
activities.body:
Hey <PERSON>,

<PERSON> is out on PTO today, so I will respond in his absence. We look forward to meeting with you and your colleague in the next week.

Below is an overview of what a yearly roll out could look like for your organization (pricing included):

  *   The Muslim Community - suggested delivery date, January (Muslim Heritage Month) (2 Facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) $4,500
  *   Black/African Community - suggested delivery date, February (Black History month) (1 Facilitator: 1 Cultural Insider) $3,000
  *   Women in Leadership - suggested delivery date, March (Women's History Month) (1 Facilitator: 1 Cultural Insider) $3,000
  *   The Jewish Community - suggested delivery date, May (Jewish Heritage Month) (2 Facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) $4,500
  *   Being an Ally for the Asian American Community - Suggested delivery date, May (AAPI Heritage month) (2 Facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) $4,500
  *   The LGBTQ+ Community - suggested delivery date, June (Pride Month) (1 Facilitator: 1 Cultural Insider) $3,000
  *   Persons with Disabilities - suggested delivery date, July (Disability Pride Month) (1 Facilitator: 1 Cultural Insider) $3,000
  *   The Hispanic Community - suggested delivery date, September (Hispanic Heritage Month) (1 Facilitator: 1 Cultural Insider) $3,000
  *   Indigenous People in <LOCATION> - suggested delivery date, October (Indigenous Peoples' Day) or November (Native American Heritage Month) (2 Facilitators: 1 Cultural Insider & 1 Ally) $4,500
  *   <LOCATION> Veterans Community - suggested delivery date, November (Veterans' Day) (1 Facilitator: 1 Cultural Insider) $3,000
  *   U.S Generations - suggested delivery date, December, April or August (1 Facilitator: 1 Cultural Insider) $3,000.
If, you plan to purchase the entire bundle of 11 spotlights, we can offer a discount of 20%= $39k - 20% = $31,200
If, you plan to purchase more then 4 individual spotlights (this can be 2 of the same one), we can offer a discount of 10%.

Please let me know what dates/times work for you next.

activities.subject: Elevate Engagement and Collaboration in 2025 with XYZ’s <LOCATION>!
activities.body:
External:

Hi Tyler,​

As you look ahead to 2025, we’re excited to introduce XYZ’s lineup of <LOCATION>—a series of 75-minute dynamic, interactive virtual trainings designed to foster engagement, support effective collaboration, and enhance intercultural competence across your organization. These sessions delve into key areas such as inclusive leadership, building cultural competence, collaborating across generations, and neurodiversity inclusion in the workplace. Each of these sessions provides practical strategies for teams to work more cohesively in today’s diverse environments.

Whether your goal is to drive engagement, inclusion, or cultural literacy, our <LOCATION> are a flexible resource that can be tailored to fit your organization’s unique goals.

Take a look at our Miniworkshop Sessions Overview<<URL>>, where you'll see the breadth of topics we cover (we can custom-build one for you too!).

We’d love to discuss how these sessions could align with your 2025 learning goals.

Looking forward to connecting!

activities.subject: REGISTER FOR COMPLIMENTARY PREVIEW: Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

At XYZ, we’re excited to share details about our upcoming Spotlight session preview, Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace, scheduled for November 13th at 1-2pm CT / 2-3pm EST.

This session will offer invaluable insights and practical strategies for fostering a more inclusive work environment, particularly for neurodivergent team members. Here’s what you can expect to learn:
Key definitions, models, and vocabulary that will help your team better understand the experiences of neurodivergent colleagues Exploration of shared cultural experiences and challenges that neurodivergent individuals often face in the workplace Proven strategies to create an inclusive environment where all neurological variations are respected and celebrated Practical inclusion skills you can apply immediately to make your workplace more welcoming to neurodivergent team members Whether you're looking to enhance your organization’s intercultural competence or create a more inclusive and supportive environment, this session provides a great opportunity to build understanding and take actionable steps toward fostering true inclusion for all.

Register here to reserve your spot:

activities.subject: EXTERNAL: New XYZ Spotlight: Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace
activities.body:
[Use caution with links & attachments]


Hi Yvonne,​

Following up on my last message about our Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace, I wanted to share how this training, along with our other Spotlights focused on the rich communities that shape every organization, can equip your team with skills they can apply right away.

This session covers:

  *   Practical inclusion strategies that your team can start using immediately to support neurodivergent colleagues.
  *   Real-world examples and insights into the cultural experiences of neurodivergent people.
  *   Tools and resources to foster a more inclusive, respectful, and innovative workplace.
I would like to schedule time to share some of these resources with you, learn about your current initiatives and answer any questions. Please let me know when is best for us to connect. We are confident this session could bring valuable insights to your team!

Looking forward to your thoughts.

activities.subject: New XYZ Spotlight: Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace
activities.body:
Hi Yvonne,​

I hope this message finds you well. We’re excited to introduce our latest timely training session, Spotlight on Neurodiversity Inclusion in the Workplace. This 75-minute virtual session, structured similar to our library of spotlights on various communities, is designed to offer valuable insights into the experiences of neurodivergent colleagues and provide practical strategies for fostering an inclusive workplace.

In this session, you’ll:
Learn the terminology and models to better understand neurodivergent experiences. Gain insights into the shared cultural experiences of neurodivergent individuals. Acquire actionable strategies to create an inclusive environment for neurodivergent team members. This course not only dives into the definitions and experiences of neurodivergent people but also helps you build an inclusive culture where every neurological difference is respected and celebrated.

Would you be open to discussing how this training can enhance your team's approach to inclusivity? We’d be happy to schedule a meeting in the next week to explore this further.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Practical inclusion strategies that your team can start using immediately to support neurodivergent colleagues. activities.subject: [EXTERNAL]: Thank You for Attending the DEIB Conference - Let's Continue the Conversation!
activities.body:
*** This message originated outside <LOCATION>. Do not open attachments or click links from unknown senders or in unexpected emails. ***
________________________________
<PERSON>

It was great to attend the 6th annual DEIB Conference in <LOCATION> on July 23rd with you. We found it to be an inspiring and impactful event and hope you did too! XYZ’s, <PERSON> had the privilege of moderating the panel, "The Future of DEI Amidst a Changing Landscape" - we hope you found the discussion thought-provoking. Due to time constraints, there were many unanswered questions submitted in the Whova app, so we wanted to follow-up with you.

XYZ has been committed to intercultural competence and inclusion in the workplace since 2000 – going through the ups and downs (but mostly ups!) with our clients, whether it’s through strategic consulting, training, or creative, collaborative projects and brainstorming with L&D, DEI, and business leaders. May we set up a 30 minute chat to provide our responses to some of the questions asked and listen to the biggest problems you’re trying to solve in your current environment? If it turns out there’s an opportunity to partner on a project - big or small, now or later - then great. And if not, that’s okay too – it would still be great to connect with you, provide some valuable resources and learn from you.

Please let us know which week you would like to meet, and we can send you our availability.

Thank you once again for taking the time to read this, and we look forward to meeting with you!

activities.subject: Following up on Monday's meeting
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON> and <PERSON> -

Attached are the sample learning paths I mentioned on Monday. We break them out by target audience - all employees, people managers, and senior leaders.

To recap some of my takeaways from our meeting:

Bright Horizon's main DEI areas of focus:

  1.  Identify why diversity and sense of belonging are decreasing at all levels
  2.  Retention and development of diverse (race/ethnicity) talent
  3.  Identify why BH is seeing lower scores in well-being for diverse (race/ethnicity only?) employees
  4.  Driving accountability amongst leaders

Next steps:

  *   BH to discern how to send existing DEI data (EES insights, insights from discussions with HR, workforce data, etc.). We must understand the data behind these issues in order  in order to develop targeted solutions.
  *   XYZ to perhaps review BH's current DEI training and provide opinion on what types of updates might be warranted.
  *   <PERSON> and <PERSON> to discuss today's meeting takeaways with <PERSON> (VP, Talent, DEI, OD and Change Management).
  *   Follow-up meeting scheduled for Monday, October 16th at 1 PM Central time. (<PERSON> is unable to attend this meeting due to PTO).

Please let us know what I missed!

Looking forward to working with y'all, <PERSON>

<PERSON><

I hope you had a great weekend!

Based on our recent conversation and the details you provided; I’m pleased to share our pricing for your custom Cross-Cultural Competency microlearning:

  *   $30K – Custom microlearning build (English only)
  *   $35K – Custom microlearning build (All languages, up to 9)

As you know, XYZ was founded in the cultural competence space, and our team brings over 25 years of expertise in this area. Personally, I’ve been developing trainings and eLearning solutions on this topic for 20 years, and we’re excited about the opportunity to bring this to life for your team.

Would you like a formal proposal with scope and timeline details, or does this overview work for your initial review? Please let me know if you have any questions and/or if you need more information.

We hope to work with you again to co-create another impactful learning for your organization.

activities.subject: BRG/ERG Support
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> -

It was wonderful to connect this week with you. Its been a while.

Per our call, I am attaching information on BRG/ERG toolkit that we developed for a client who needed some added assistance in 'professionalizing' their approach to BRG/ERGs. They found that they didn't have a standard model, or even a standard set of expectations for their BRGs, as each had developed organically over the years. They also found that their Executive Sponsorship was inconsistent among the BRGs.

We led multiple conversations with represented populations to see what they know of BRGs at the organization, what they expected from their BRGs, and what was keeping them from joining (if they hadn't). We also spoke to the business leadership to understand their expectations. We then used this data to form the training and consulting interventions for both the BRG leaders and the executive sponsors.

I will schedule some time next week to discuss any questions you might have.

<PERSON>

On Wed, Feb 19, 2025 at 3:59 PM <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS><mailto:<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>> wrote:
Hi <PERSON>,

Thanks for your time today and for reaching out to XYZ.

We offer three flexible engagement models designed to meet your organization's specific DEI needs around navigating this new DEI landscape —whether you need ongoing strategic guidance, a flexible consulting approach, or a structured, program-based solution.

As mentioned on the call, we partner with a global law firm to provide guidance in over 40 countries. XYZ has worked globally for 25 years and has subject matter experts in most countries around the world who consult on all things DEI.

1 - Subscription-Based / Retainer Model
Best for organizations looking for ongoing strategic DEI support and real-time consultation.

What’s Included:

  *   Monthly or quarterly DEI strategy sessions with senior advisors.
  *   Ongoing guidance on compliance, legal risks, and policy updates.
  *   Access to on-demand consulting for crisis response and organizational change management.
  *   Advisory support for HR, leadership, and DEI teams on evolving initiatives.
  *   Priority access to new DEI research, legal updates, and training content.

Pricing:

  *   $8,500 – $15,000 per month (based on scope, number of hours, and level of access to DEI experts).
  *   3-month, 6-month, or 12-month commitment required.

2 - Consulting Hours - Flexible Blocks of Time
Best for organizations that need expert DEI guidance on an as-needed basis.

What’s Included:

  *   Strategic DEI consulting available in flexible hour blocks.
  *   Support for DEI training updates, legal compliance, change management, and risk mitigation.
  *   Ad hoc guidance on emerging DEI challenges, leadership coaching, and workforce strategy.
  *   Assistance with policy review, DEI assessments, and communication strategies.

Pricing:

  *   20 hours → $12,000
  *   40 hours → $22,000
  *   60 hours → $30,000
  *   Hours can be used over 12 months.

3 - DEI Transformation Program
Best for organizations seeking a structured, end-to-end approach for navigating the current DEI landscape.

What’s Included:

  *   Organizational DEI Assessment – in-depth review of current programs and policies.
  *
Strategy Reframing Workshop – Reframe DEI as a critical lever for workforce development, leadership development, and business performance, ensuring alignment with the organization's goals, culture, and values.
  *
Communication & Stakeholder Alignment Toolkit - Equip DEI professionals and organizational leaders with tools to communicate DEI’s business value, engage leadership, and build organizational buy-in.
  *   Custom 6-month, 12-month or 24-month DEI <PERSON> – detailed implementation plan.
  *   Business Case for DEI – senior leadership report on DEI impact & ROI.
  *   Legal & Compliance Guidance – global and <LOCATION> legal considerations.
  *   Change Management & Crisis Planning – strategies for sustaining DEI efforts in shifting environments.
  *   Facilitator Training (Train-the-Trainer, if applicable).

Pricing:

  *   $50,000 – $100,000, depending on scope and level of customization.
  *   Timeline: 3 to 6 months of implementation support.

Lastly, I will add that best practices in this area are hard to really find, as everyone is still navigating these changes in real time. That said, when we have our findings from our clients, I will be sure to share with you.

Please let me know what model interests you the most. I can then send you additional details and/or we can schedule another call where one of our senior consultants will join to share more information with you.

Looking forward to talking again soon.

activities.subject: Re: Thank You for Contacting <PERSON>
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

Thank you for your participation in Mozilla’s DEI consultant search
process. I truly appreciate the time, care, and insight you've brought to
the table in all of our correspondence thus far.

I also want to apologize for the delay in sharing this update. After
careful consideration, we’ve made the decision to pause the search for a
DEI consultant partner at this time. This shift reflects a reassessment of
internal priorities and timing, rather than any reflection on the quality
of your proposal.

I was genuinely impressed by the depth of your expertise and the strength
of your approach in all of our previous conversations, and am grateful to
have had the opportunity to learn more about your work. I hope to remain in
touch and look forward to potential opportunities to collaborate in the
future.

activities.subject: Re: Thank You for Contacting <PERSON>
activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

I hope your week is going well.

Just checking back in to see how we can assist.

Since we last chatted, we've being doing a lot of consulting for clients around navigating this current shift in the DEI landscape. Happy to chat more about what we've been doing if it helps.

Let me know.

activities.body:
Hi <PERSON>,

I appreciate the update, thank you!
Happy Juneteenth!

If you ever just need to run any thoughts by our team, please do not hesitate. I know there are so many changes going on in the space right now.

Also, would you be able to connect me with someone at your organization who is in charge of international assignees / global mobility or international business travelers? We also specialize in cultural business training for those relocating to and doing business in other countries.

No worries & thanks for the update, <PERSON>.

activities.subject: SOW for InStride + XYZ
activities.body:
Hi Chuck--

Thank you for meeting with me and reviewing the available options for InStride's DEIB training program. As discussed, I'd like to move forward with the following sessions:

  *   Facilitated session, "Leading with Conscious Inclusion" (managers & leaders)
     *   $8,000 per session for two (2) sessions of 20-30 people each
     *   $16,000 total
  *   E-learning session, "Foundations of Diversity & Inclusion"
     *   $50 per person for 180 employees
     *   $9,000 total

Those sessions would come to a total of $25,000 for 2025.

If it is at all possible to get a price break on the fully facilitated session titled, "Cultural Competence & Inclusion Skill-Building: Building a Culture of Inclusion," I would love to add 4 of those sessions so that it's not just our team leaders receiving training.

Please let me know if you need any further information to build out a proposal. Thank you!

<PERSON>
Employee Engagement Manager
<PHONE_NUMBER> | <URL><

activities.subject: Re: XYZ Quotes for Programming
activities.body:
Thank you very much, <PERSON>! I've had some time to go through the menu and
have a few questions about pricing for each course.

I'm interested in the following sessions, divided by type. Are they priced
by the hour, by the session or both? Let's assume we have 40 people in each
session, would we need 3 or 4 sessions of each?

   - Facilitated learning
      - Cultural Competence & Inclusion Skill-Building: Building a Culture
      of Inclusion (all audiences)
      - Inclusion Skill-Building: Brave Conversations on Race + Power of
      AllyshipCulture (all audiences)
      - Cultural Competence & Inclusion Skill-Building: Building a Culture
      of Inclusion + Leading with Conscious Inclusion (managers & leaders)
   - eLearning
      - Foundations of Diversity & Inclusion (all audiences)
      - Fostering Collaboration (all audiences)
   - Mini-workshops
      - Foundations of Diversity & Inclusion
      - Spotlight on Intersectionality

I realize I am repeating myself with the foundations courses, but I think
it's important to offer this in different ways so the message clicks for
everyone, and also because I don't know that everyone will attend each kind
of session.

Can you tell me what the cost of those selections would be, based on a
company of 160 people? We have 50-60 people who are people managers and
would be in the manager & leader sessions.

Thank you!

activities.body:
Happy Friday, <PERSON>!

I wanted to send you the proposal for the other courses containing the 15% discount that I mentioned in our last email. That way you had it on paper to socialize. Keep in mind that I am including the sessions designed to general audiences in this proposal. We could swap 1 or more of these for the course designed specifically for managers and leaders with the same 15% discount.

Note that we changed the name of the Building a Culture of Inclusion course to Collaborating Across Cultures a few months back. It is the same course.

Let me know if there is anything you need to move this forward within your organization. I am available to walk through the content at a high level if that helps.

Thank you very much, <PERSON>! I've had some time to go through the menu and have a few questions about pricing for each course.

I'm interested in the following sessions, divided by type. Are they priced by the hour, by the session or both? It's a little of both and the number of faciltators. Let's assume we have 40 people in each session, would we need 3 or 4 sessions of each? We usually suggest that sessions be limited to 25-30 people in order to maximize interaction and engagement. We find that active participation suffers as the number of participants increases. We are flexible, though.

  *   Facilitated learning
     *
Cultural Competence & Inclusion Skill-Building: Building a Culture of Inclusion (all audiences)  Pricing is $8,000 per session.
     *
Inclusion Skill-Building: Brave Conversations on Race + Power of Allyship Culture (all audiences) Pricing is $8,000 per session for each.
     *
Cultural Competence & Inclusion Skill-Building: Building a Culture of Inclusion Pricing is $12,000 per session + Leading with Conscious Inclusion (managers & leaders)  Pricing is $8,000 per session
  *   ELearning - We have two models for elearning; 1) a price based on org size which starts at $20k for up to 10,000 users, and 2) for smaller organizations we host the modules for $50 for each user (for 12 months). The latter would work best for you folks.
     *   Foundations of Diversity & Inclusion (all audiences)
     *   Fostering Collaboration (all audiences)
  *   Mini-workshops
     *   Foundations of Diversity & Inclusion Price is $3,600 per session
     *   Spotlight on Intersectionality Price is $3,600 per session

I realize I am repeating myself with the foundations courses, but I think it's important to offer this in different ways so the message clicks for everyone, and also because I don't know that everyone will attend each kind of session.

Can you tell me what the cost of those selections would be, based on a company of 160 people? We have 50-60 people who are people managers and would be in the manager & leader sessions.

Thank you!

activities.subject: ERG Strategy and Governance
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> the delay in getting this to you. I was out ill yesterday.

Attached is the proposal for the ERG Strategy and Governance consulting engagement. You'll note that the Phase 1 includes two (2) Focus Groups and six (6) 1:1 leader interviews to understand the alignment of expectations of the ERG, what is working and what isn't, along with suggestions on areas of opportunities. We also like to talk to folks who aren't part of the ERGs to identify what barriers exist to them joining. The focus groups can be up to 20 people each. Additional focus groups are $4,500. Additional interviews are $1,600.

Let's plan to connect next week so that I can respond to any questions you might have.

I look forward to talking.

<PERSON>

activities.subject: Proposal for Collaborating Across Cultures (CAC/BCI)
activities.body:
Happy Friday, <PERSON>!

I wanted to send you the proposal for the other courses containing the 15% discount that I mentioned in our last email. That way you had it on paper to socialize. Keep in mind that I am including the sessions designed to general audiences in this proposal. We could swap 1 or more of these for the course designed specifically for managers and leaders with the same 15% discount.

Note that we changed the name of the Building a Culture of Inclusion course to Collaborating Across Cultures a few months back. It is the same course.

Let me know if there is anything you need to move this forward within your organization. I am available to walk through the content at a high level if that helps.

Feel free to schedule time with me below.

<PERSON>

activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> –

Attached are the information deck and  proposal with pricing we discussed. Don’t be put off by the final cost in the proposal. 😊  To build the proposal I had to assume some things around the final number of sessions and the specific manager/leader training you might be interested in. Note that any of the products in the deck can be swapped out for assumptions made in the proposal.

Either way, think of this as a menu that we can customize accordingly.

You’ll notice that I did not provide pricing on the Diversity Leadership Governance piece yet. I need to talk with the team about how best to represent that outside of the ERG/BRG Consulting Package. As I was reviewing the program I noticed that there wasn’t a clean line item for that piece alone. I will work to get you that tomorrow.

Please let me know if you want to meet and discuss anything sent here. We can schedule a follow up call for end of this week/early next week at your convenience.

activities.subject: Re: XYZ Quotes for Programming
activities.body:
Thank you very much, <PERSON>! I've had some time to go through the menu and have a few questions about pricing for each course.

I'm interested in the following sessions, divided by type. Are they priced by the hour, by the session or both? It's a little of both and the number of faciltators. Let's assume we have 40 people in each session, would we need 3 or 4 sessions of each? We usually suggest that sessions be limited to 25-30 people in order to maximize interaction and engagement. We find that active participation suffers as the number of participants increases. We are flexible, though.

  *   Facilitated learning
     *
Cultural Competence & Inclusion Skill-Building: Building a Culture of Inclusion (all audiences)  Pricing is $8,000 per session.
     *
Inclusion Skill-Building: Brave Conversations on Race + Power of Allyship Culture (all audiences) Pricing is $8,000 per session for each.
     *
Cultural Competence & Inclusion Skill-Building: Building a Culture of Inclusion Pricing is $12,000 per session + Leading with Conscious Inclusion (managers & leaders)  Pricing is $8,000 per session
  *   ELearning - We have two models for elearning; 1) a price based on org size which starts at $20k for up to 10,000 users, and 2) for smaller organizations we host the modules for $50 for each user (for 12 months). The latter would work best for you folks.
     *   Foundations of Diversity & Inclusion (all audiences)
     *   Fostering Collaboration (all audiences)
  *   Mini-workshops
     *   Foundations of Diversity & Inclusion Price is $3,600 per session
     *   Spotlight on Intersectionality Price is $3,600 per session

I realize I am repeating myself with the foundations courses, but I think it's important to offer this in different ways so the message clicks for everyone, and also because I don't know that everyone will attend each kind of session.

Can you tell me what the cost of those selections would be, based on a company of 160 people? We have 50-60 people who are people managers and would be in the manager & leader sessions.

Thank you!

Either way, think of this as a menu that we can customize accordingly.



You’ll notice that I did not provide pricing on the Diversity Leadership Governance piece yet. I need to talk with the team about how best to represent that outside of the ERG/BRG Consulting Package. As I was reviewing the program I noticed that there wasn’t a clean line item for that piece alone. I will work to get you that tomorrow.



Please let me know if you want to meet and discuss anything sent here. We can schedule a follow up call for end of this week/early next week at your convenience.

activities.subject: ERG Strategy and Governance
activities.body:
Hi, <PERSON> the delay in getting this to you. I was out ill yesterday.

Attached is the proposal for the ERG Strategy and Governance consulting engagement. You'll note that the Phase 1 includes two (2) Focus Groups and six (6) 1:1 leader interviews to understand the alignment of expectations of the ERG, what is working and what isn't, along with suggestions on areas of opportunities. We also like to talk to folks who aren't part of the ERGs to identify what barriers exist to them joining. The focus groups can be up to 20 people each. Additional focus groups are $4,500. Additional interviews are $1,600.

Let's plan to connect next week so that I can respond to any questions you might have.

I look forward to talking.

<PERSON>

<PERSON> (He/Him)
Chief Executive Officer
XYZ
Office: <PHONE_NUMBER>
Mobile: <PHONE_NUMBER>
